lacunarium: <entryFree id="n25606" type="main" key="la^cu_na_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcūnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. lacunar.</entryFree>
lacunarius: <entryFree id="n25607" type="main" key="la^cu_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcūnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lacuna</etym>, <sense id="n25607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gravedigger</hi> (late Lat.), Firm. Math. 8, 21; cf.: lacunarius, <foreign lang="greek">lakkopolo/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lacunatura: <entryFree id="n25608" type="main" key="la^cu_na_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcūnātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. lacuna, I. B. <sense id="n25608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lacuno: <entryFree id="n25609" type="main" key="la^cu_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcūno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lacuna</etym>. *<sense id="n25609.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To hollow out, to fret</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacunati tori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25609.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To panel like a</hi> lacunar: <cit><quote lang="la">summa lacunabant alterno murice conchae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 564</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacunosus: <entryFree id="n25610" type="main" key="la^cu_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcūnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n25610.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of holes, ponds</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sloughs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convallis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 105, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(via) lacunosis incilibus voraginosa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, p. 221, 1.—</sense><sense id="n25610.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">full of hollows, gaps</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cavities</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil eminens, nihil lacunosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lacus: <entryFree id="n25611" type="main" key="la^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n25611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> laci, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:37:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 37, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 11, 14</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> lacis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 5, 71, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 20, § 33</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">usually lacubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:278 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 278 al.</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root lak, to tear; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la/kos, lakero/s, la/kkos</foreign>; Lat. lacer, lacinia, lacuna, lāma; cf. lacerna; originally any thing hollow, hence</etym>. </sense><sense id="n25611.1" n="I" level="1"> A large vessel for liquids, <hi rend="ital">a basin, tank, tub;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">a vat</hi> into which the wine flowed from the press, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">67, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quoque devotos, Bacche, relinque lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de lacubus proxima musta tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:888" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 888</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">a tank of water, in which heated metal was cooled: alii stridentia tingunt Aera lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gelido ceu quondam lamina candens tincta lacu, stridit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum, igne rubens ... lacubus demittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:278" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 278</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25611.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio quasi de musto ac lacu fervida,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>still new, that has not done fermenting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:288" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 288</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25611.3" n="II" level="1"> A large body of water which rises and falls (opp. stagnum, a standing pool), <hi rend="ital">a lake, pond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri, aedificia, lacus, stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhalant lacus nebulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 463</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deae, quae illos Hennenses lacus lucosque incolitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:72:section=188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 72, § 188</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">2, 4, 48, § 107: Averni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 746</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fucinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicebar sicco vilior esse lacu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14</bibl></cit> (3, 6), 12: <cit><quote lang="la">ad spurcos lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:603" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 603</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a river: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde lacu fluvius se condidit alto Ima petens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. v. 74; <cit><quote lang="la">of the Styx,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 134</bibl></cit>; 238; 393.—</sense><sense id="n25611.4" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A large reservoir for water, a basin, tank, cistern</hi> (of which there were a great number in Rome), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:78" default="NO">78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a furno redeuntes lacuque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 37</bibl></cit>.—A place called Lacus: garruli et malevoli supra Lacum, <hi rend="ital">at the pond</hi> (perh. Lacus Curtius or Lacus Juturnae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 16</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">siccus lacus, for something useless,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:11:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 11, 11</bibl></cit> (3, 6, 12).—</sense><sense id="n25611.5" n="IV" level="1"> </sense><sense id="n25611.6" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A hole in which lime is slacked, a lime-hole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25611.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">One of the bins</hi> or <hi rend="ital">receptacles for pulse in a granary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed et lacubus distinguuntur granaria, ut separatim quaeque legumina ponantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25611.8" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A den</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cave for lions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labitur in lacum leonum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 6, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25611.9" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The pit, the place of the dead</hi> (cf. II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> supra): <cit><quote lang="la">salvasti me a descendentibus in lacum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 29, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25611.10" n="V" level="1"> For lacunar, <hi rend="ital">a panel in a ceiling</hi> (ante-class.): resultant aedesque lacusque, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 726</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacusculus: <entryFree id="n25612" type="main" key="la^cuscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lacus</etym>. <sense id="n25612.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little lake</hi> (only in Columella), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 10, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25612.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A receptacle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bin for keeping olives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:50:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 50, 3 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
lacuturris: <entryFree id="n25613" type="main" key="la^cu^turris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcŭturris</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (sc. caulis), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lacusturris</etym>, <sense id="n25613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cabbage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacydes: <entryFree id="n25614" type="main" key="La^cy^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcydes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*laku/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n25614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Academician of Cyrene, a pupil of Arcesilas</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37, 107</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lacydon: <entryFree id="n25615" type="main" key="La^cy^don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăcydon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the port of Marseilles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massiliensium portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lada: <entryFree id="n25616" type="greek" key="la_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāda</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēdon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lh=don</foreign>. <sense id="n25616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shrub in Cyprus from which a</hi> <pb n="1029" /> <cb n="LAEL" /> <hi rend="ital">resin was obtained</hi>, the Cistus Creticus, Linn.; <cit><quote lang="la">form lada,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 43, § 97</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">form leda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 75</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">form ledon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 8, 30, § 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ladanum: <entryFree id="n25617" type="greek" key="la_da^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lādănum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lēdănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">lh/danon</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n25617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the resinous juice obtained from the shrub</hi> lada, <hi rend="ital">ladanum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:47 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 30, § 47 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ladas: <entryFree id="n25618" type="main" key="La_das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lādas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/das</foreign>, <sense id="n25618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a runner of Alexander the Great, whose name became a proverb for swiftness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 1, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:100:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 100, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:86:8" default="NO">2, 86, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 85:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 85, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauper locupletem optare podagram Ne dubitet Ladas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ladon: <entryFree id="n25619" type="main" key="La_don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lādon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/dwn</foreign>. <sense id="n25619.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Arcadia which flows into the Alphēus;</hi> the fabled <hi rend="ital">father of Daphne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 702</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:25:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 25, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. E. 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Aen. 3, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25619.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of one of Actæon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 216</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laeana: <entryFree id="n25620" type="main" key="Laea_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laeāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 156</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laeānīta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant thereof</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 156</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Laeānītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laeca: <entryFree id="n25621" type="main" key="Laeca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laeca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> e. g. M. Porcius Laeca, <hi rend="ital">one of Catiline's fellowconspirators</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuisti apud Laecam illa nocte, Catilina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laecasin: <entryFree id="n25622" type="main" key="laecasin"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laecasin</orth>, <itype>an imprecation</itype> ( = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">laiki/zein</foreign>), <sense id="n25622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">go to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dico frigori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0972,001:42:2" default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> S. 42, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laedo: <entryFree id="n25623" type="main" key="laedo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laedo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>perh. for lavido, root lu-; cf.: luo, solvo, and Germ. los-</etym>, <sense id="n25623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hurt</hi> by striking, <hi rend="ital">wound, injure, damage</hi> (syn.: saucio, vulnero). </sense><sense id="n25623.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lora laedunt bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lembus ille mihi laedit latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua laesuro subtrahe colla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondes laedit hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:150" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneros laedunt prima juga juvencos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">thymum laeditur imbribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 31, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vulnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid me dente captas laedere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro retunso Semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsā laedit rubigine ferrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 220</bibl></cit>: servum aliqua parte corporis, Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 219</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hang one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laesus nube dies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>darkened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 456</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25623.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to trouble, annoy, vex, injure, offend, afflict, grieve, hurt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicto, facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuste neminem laesit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 40, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non minus nos stultitia illius sublevat, quam laedit improbitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 9, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem perjurio suo,</quote> <trans><tr>to attack</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pisonem,</quote> <trans><tr>to rail at</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli os,</quote> <trans><tr>to offend no one to his face</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua me infortunia laedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristi laedere versu scurram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: te a me ludibrio laesum iri, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae laedunt oculum, demere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17, 8</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia laesit prior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec laedere nec violari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1020" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1020</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25623.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n25623.4" n="1" level="3"> Of pledged faith, one's word, agreement, etc., <hi rend="ital">to break, violate, betray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur tibi junior laesa praeniteat fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laesi testatur foederis aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laesae vulnera pacis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25623.5" n="2" level="3"> Of reputation, <hi rend="ital">to harm, injure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam alicujus gravi opprobrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25623.6" n="3" level="3"> Freq. of an offended divinity: <cit><quote lang="la">quo numine laeso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu magnorum numen laesura deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego laedor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 608</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris numina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:79" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:26" default="NO">3, 6, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">superos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 848</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25623.7" n="4" level="3"> Of circumstances: <cit><quote lang="la">res laesae,</quote> <trans><tr>disaster, misfortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:6:5" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 6, 5</bibl></cit>.—Esp., in the phrase laedere majestatem, <hi rend="ital">to commit treason</hi> (late Lat., v. also majestas): <cit><quote lang="la">laesae majestatis arcessere maritum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laesae crimina majestatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21, 12, 19</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">laedere majestatem populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:25:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 25, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laelaps: <entryFree id="n25624" type="main" key="Laelaps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laelaps</orth>, <itype>ăpis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">lai/lay</foreign>, hurricane</etym>, <sense id="n25624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 211</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 771</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laelius: <entryFree id="n25625" type="main" key="Laeli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laelĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n25625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens.— So esp., </sense><sense id="n25625.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Lælius, <hi rend="ital">a friend of Scipio Africanus</hi>: in quo Laeliu' clamores, <foreign lang="greek">sofo\s</foreign> ille, solebat Edere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dubitare illum (C. Laelium) in omni sermone appellare sapientem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 21, 82</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">72</bibl>. Cicero's treatise on Friendship is named after him.—</sense><sense id="n25625.2" n="2" level="3"> D. Lælius, <hi rend="ital">a writer of moderate abilities</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 6, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25625.3" n="3" level="3"> Another D. Lælius, perh. a son <cb n="LAET" /> of the preceding, <hi rend="ital">an adherent of Pompey</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 40</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laelĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of C. Lælius, and mother-in-law of L. Crassus, celebrated for her intellectual culiure</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:211" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 58, 211</bibl>.—Another Lælia, <hi rend="ital">a Vestal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 22</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laelĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Lælius, Lælian</hi>: naves, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of Pompey's commander</hi>, D. Lælius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:100:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 100, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laena: <entryFree id="n25626" type="main" key="laena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xlai/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n25626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lined upper garment, a cloak, mantle</hi>: laena vestimenti genus habitu duplicis. Quidam appellatam existimant Tusce, quidam Graece, quam <foreign lang="greek">xlani/da</foreign> dicunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=117" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 117</bibl> Müll. Usually worn by the flamens over the toga, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 262</bibl>. Also by persons of distinction,-Verg. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:424" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 424</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:31" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:283" default="NO">3, 283</bibl>; v. Dict. of Antiq.</sense></entryFree>
laenas: <entryFree id="n25627" type="main" key="Laenas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laenas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <sense id="n25627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Popilia, v. Popilius.</sense></entryFree>
laeotomus: <entryFree id="n25628" type="greek" key="laeo^to^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laeŏtŏmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">laio/tomos</foreign>, <sense id="n25628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chord of a segment of a circle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 8, 6</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. lacotomus).</sense></entryFree>
laertes: <entryFree id="n25629" type="main" key="La_ertes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāërtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>nom.</case> Laërta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 699" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 699</bibl>; <sense id="n25629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Laërtis, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 705</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lae/rths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Ulysses</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 314, 20</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 131 Rib.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 113</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25629.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25629.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāërtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Laertes, Laertian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ithaca</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Ulysses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 326</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25629.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāërtĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*laertia/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Laertes: his son Ulysses</hi>, Att. ap. App. de Deo Socr. c. 24 (Trag. Rel. v. 524 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 5, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laertius: <entryFree id="n25630" type="main" key="La_ertius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāërtius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n25630.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, from Laërtes, q. v. II. A.—</sense><sense id="n25630.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An inhabitant of Laertes, a seaport town in Cilicia</hi>, e. g. Diogenes Laërtius, <hi rend="ital">a Greek historian in the third century of the Christian era</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
laesio: <entryFree id="n25631" type="main" key="laesi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laesĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>laedo</etym>, <sense id="n25631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hurting, injuring</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25631.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only in late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">si quod, absente socio, ad laesionem fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3:28" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non ad publicam laesionem respiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:7:section=14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 14, 7, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritat laesio dolorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ira D. 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Esdr. 4, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla laesio est in eo quia credidit Deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dan. 6, 23</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n25631.2" n="II" level="1"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a personal attack by an orator on his opponent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgatio, conciliatio, laesio, optatio atque exsecratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 205</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laestrygon: <entryFree id="n25632" type="main" key="Laestry_gon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laestrȳgon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lestr-</orth>), <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, more freq. in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laestrȳgŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*laistrugo/nes</foreign>, <sense id="n25632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient people of Italy, originally in Campania, in the region around Formiæ, and afterwards in Sicily, who are fabled to have been savages and cannibals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 1, 2, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 641</bibl>. —In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 233</bibl>.—Of Laestrygonians in Sicily, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:125" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 125</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25632.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laestrȳgŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Læstrygonians, Læstrygonian</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25632.2" n="A" level="2"> In Formiae: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Formiæ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:390" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 390</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <trans><tr>in Formiæ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:276" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Campanian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25632.3" n="B" level="2"> In Sicily: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laesura: <entryFree id="n25633" type="main" key="laesu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laesūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>laedo</etym>, <sense id="n25633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hurting, injuring</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">divitiarum,</quote> <trans><tr>loss</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ANIMI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 828, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laesus: <entryFree id="n25634" type="main" key="laesus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laesus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from laedo.</entryFree>
laeta: <entryFree id="n25635" type="main" key="laeta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laeta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. 2. laetus.</entryFree>
laetabilis: <entryFree id="n25636" type="main" key="laeta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laetor</etym>, <sense id="n25636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joyful, glad, gladsome</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid habet ista res aut laetabile, aut gloriosum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil laetabile,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:606" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 606</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Genethl. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laetabundus: <entryFree id="n25637" type="main" key="laeta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatly rejoicing, full of joy, joyful</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">laetabundus is dicitur, qui abunde laetus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:15:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his dictis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 35, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laetamen: <entryFree id="n25638" type="main" key="laeta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dung, manure</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 40, § 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anserum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laetans: <entryFree id="n25639" type="main" key="laetans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from laetor.</entryFree>
laetanter: <entryFree id="n25640" type="main" key="laetanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. laetor <sense id="n25640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
laetatio: <entryFree id="n25641" type="hapax" key="laeta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>laetor</etym>, <sense id="n25641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rejoicing, exultation, joy</hi> (for the usual laetitia): <cit><quote lang="la">diutina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> <cb n="LAET" /></sense></entryFree>
laete: <entryFree id="n25642" type="main" key="laete_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. laetus <sense id="n25642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
laeticulosus: <entryFree id="n25643" type="hapax" key="laeti^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetĭcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laetor</etym>, <sense id="n25643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">too joyful, overjoyful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu laeticulosus (al. lacticulosus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. Trag. 57</bibl></cit> Burm.</sense></entryFree>
laeticus: <entryFree id="n25644" type="main" key="laeti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 2. laetus.</entryFree>
laetifico: <entryFree id="n25645" type="main" key="laeti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laetificus</etym>, <sense id="n25645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cheer, gladden, delight;</hi> constr. with <case>abl.</case> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non illum gloria pulsi Laetificat Magni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol laetificat terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 21, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 19, 9</bibl></cit>; 103, 15.— Mid., <hi rend="ital">to rejoice, be glad</hi> respecting any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc eo alii laetificantur Meo malo et damno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25645.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in agriculture, <hi rend="ital">to render fruitful, to fertilize, enrich, manure</hi> the ground: <cit><quote lang="la">Indus agros laetificat et mitigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faba solum laetificat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 30, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetificata seges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">laetĭfĭcans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., rejoicing, joyous</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">unde ego omnes hilares, lubentes, laetificantes faciam ut fiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laetificus: <entryFree id="n25646" type="main" key="laeti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laetus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n25646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making glad, gladdening, glad, joyful, joyous</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 193</bibl></cit>; cf. vites, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl> (Trag. v. 193 Vahl.): gau (i. e. gaudium), id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Technop. 144</bibl> (Ann. v. 451 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:261" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plausus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 521</bibl></cit>. —In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laetĭfĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">joyful news</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetifica referre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 597" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 597</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laetisco: <entryFree id="n25647" type="hapax" key="laetisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetisco</orth>, <itype>3</itype>, <sense id="n25647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch.</hi> [laetus], <hi rend="ital">to rejoice</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 133, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laetitia: <entryFree id="n25648" type="main" key="laeti^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joy</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">unrestrained joyfulness, gladness, pleasure, delight</hi> (cf.: gaudium, hilaritas). </sense><sense id="n25648.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia opinio recens boni praesentis, in quo efferri rectum esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:7:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia dicitur exsultatio quaedam animi gaudio efferventior eventu rerum expetitarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:27:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium plenum laetitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">percipere laetitiam ex re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prae laetitia lacrumae prosuliunt mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mea laetitia laetus promiscam siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus in laetitiam effusus,</quote> <trans><tr>wholly dissolved in pleasure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem perpetuum in laetitia degere,</quote> <trans><tr>to spend joyfully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne me in laetitiam frustra conicias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiae dator,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:734" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 734</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">efferri laetitiā,</quote> <trans><tr>to be transported with joy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfrui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afficere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia me laetitiā extulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>have rejoiced me exceedingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam capere oculis,</quote> <trans><tr>to enjoy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to give delight to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et altera traditur circensis turbae non minus similis veri laetitia,</quote> <trans><tr>another outbreak of joy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hanc laetitiam nec opinanti primus ei obicerem domi,</quote> <trans><tr>this cause of joy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">offerre laetitiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 18</bibl></cit>.—Esp. of success in love, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:32" default="NO">2, 6, 32</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaero quoi ter trinas triplicis tribus demeritas artibus Dem laetitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: incessi omnibus laetitiis laetus, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 9, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25648.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing appearance, beauty, grace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:571" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 571</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Luxuriance, fertility</hi>, of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">trunci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabuli,</quote> <trans><tr>plenty, abundance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:4:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—Of a fruitful soil: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of speech, <hi rend="ital">sweetness, grace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia et pulcritudo orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laetitudo: <entryFree id="n25649" type="main" key="laeti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, ante-class. for laetitia, <sense id="n25649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joy</hi>: me excitasti ex luctu in laetitudinem, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 132, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">affecti laetitudine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13</bibl></cit> (Trag. Fragm. v. 61, 259 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
laeto: <entryFree id="n25650" type="main" key="laeto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laeto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make joyful, to delight, cheer, gladden</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25650.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante- and post-class.): oculos specie laetavisti optabili, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 132, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ut triplici laetarem bono, Att. ib.: frontem alicujus serena venustate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 134, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25650.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of the soil, <hi rend="ital">to fertilize, render fertile, manure</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">in laetandis arboribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca sterilia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laetor: <entryFree id="n25651" type="main" key="laetor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n25651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [lit. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of laeto], <hi rend="ital">to rejoice, feel joy, be joyful</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glad</hi> <pb n="1030" /> <cb n="LAET" /> at any thing (syn. gaudeo); constr. with <case>abl.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">in, de, ex</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">super</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">neutr. acc.</hi>, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25651.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisquam amator nuptiis laetetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et laetari bonis rebus et dolere contrariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua re gesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetor tum praesenti, tum sperata tua dignitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetabitur cor meum quasi a vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:10:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:310" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 310</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25651.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetaris tu in omnium gemitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc est laetatus, quod,</quote> <trans><tr>because that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad laetandum in laetitia gentis tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:105:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 105, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Domino,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 96, 12</bibl></cit>; 84, 7 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n25651.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">de communi salute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Marc. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de labore suo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25651.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vaccenses ex perfidia laetati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 69, 3</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">super</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">super hederā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jonah, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 39, 2</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">neutr. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud mihi laetandum video, quod,</quote> <trans><tr>because that</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 1</bibl></cit>; but rarely with <hi rend="ital">acc. of direct object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetandum magis quam dolendum casum tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos erat Aeacides voltu laetatus honores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 322</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">istuc tibi ex sententia tua obtigisse laetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae perfecta esse gaudeo, judices, vehementerque laetor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:47:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 47, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem esse natum ... haec civitas laetabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque laetor, et sine dolore corporis te fuisse et animo valuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vero Alciden me sum laetatus euntem accepisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 392</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, in connection with memini: <cit><quote lang="la">nec veterum memini laetorve malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 280</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25651.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. subjects, <hi rend="ital">to delight, rejoice, be joyful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne vitis genus naturaliter laetatur tepore potius, quam frigore,</quote> <trans><tr>is fonder of warmth than of cold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta omnia maxime laetantur patenti campo,</quote> <trans><tr>delight in</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetatur mons Sion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 47</bibl></cit>. 12.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">laetans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., rejoicing, joyful, glad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos nunc laetantis faciam adventu meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubit Oppianico continuo Sassia laetanti jam animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <trans><tr>delightful, cheerful, agreeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 344</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laetanter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with joy, joyfully</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laetorius: <entryFree id="n25652" type="main" key="Laeto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laetōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n25652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:26:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 26, 13</bibl> (but lex Plaetoria is the true reading, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 12, 2).</sense></entryFree>
laetus: <entryFree id="n25653" type="main" key="laetus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root prī-, to cheer; prētis, joy, love; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">prau+/s, pra=|os</foreign>; Germ. Friede, Freude; cf. also Latin gentile name, Plaetorius</etym>, <sense id="n25653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">joyful, cheerful, glad, gay, joyous, rejoicing, pleased, delighted, full of joy</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25653.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25653.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeti atque erecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alacres laetique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies laetissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae tuae partim laeta partim tristia continent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus est de amica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus animi et ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:93:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 93, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:308" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 308</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus uterque Spectari superis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:453" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 453</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus sum, fratri obtigisse quod volt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta est abs te (donum) datum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25653.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Doing a thing with joy, cheerful, ready, willing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus supplementum etiam laetus decreverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">descendere regno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:396" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatebere laetus nec surdum esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:248" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 248</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Delighting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taking pleasure in</hi> a thing; with <case>abl.</case> or <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25653.9" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">et laetum equino sanguine Concanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus stridore catenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantaribus horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ferro vivere laetum Vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:223" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 223</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pleased, satisfied with</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">delighting in;</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis Romana haudquaquam laeta praedā rediit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentus modicis, meoque laetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:77:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 77, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetissimus viae,</quote> <trans><tr>indulging to the full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:308" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 308</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.12" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pleasing, pleasant</hi>, <cb n="LAEV" /> <hi rend="ital">grateful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia erant facta hoc biduo laetiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetique nuntii vulgabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium laetissimi fructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus haud laeta tyranno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:30" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militibus id nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.13" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Favorable, propitious, prosperous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:31" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:540" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 540</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:552" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 552</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saecula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 605</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:77" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (proelii) initium ambiguum, finis laetior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.14" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fortunate, auspicious, lucky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 77, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta et congruentia exta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.15" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Joyous in appearance, delightful, pleasing, beautiful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vite quid potest esse cum fructu laetius, tum aspectu pulchrius?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupae fulvo nutricis tegmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferarum exuviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:475" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 475</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indoles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles frondibus laeti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:4:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.16" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in econom. lang., <hi rend="ital">fertile, rich</hi>, of soil: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta Clitumni pascua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:13" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 13</bibl></cit>.—Of cattle, <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glande sues laeti redeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 520</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.17" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Abundant, copious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta magis pressis manabunt flumina mammis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 310</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 494</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus laetissimus umbrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 441</bibl></cit>.—Of style, etc., <hi rend="ital">rich, copious, agreeable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitidum quoddam genus est verborum et laetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:18:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 18, 81</bibl></cit>.—Of the author: <cit><quote lang="la">(Homerus) laetus ac pressus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.18" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pleasant, agreeable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi genus tenue laetioribus numeris corrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 17</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">neutr. sing.</hi>, adverbially: <cit><quote lang="la">laetumque rubet,</quote> <trans><tr>with joy, with pleasure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:323" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 323</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laetē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">joyfully, gladly, cheerfully</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25653.19" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">auctorem senatus exstinctum laete atque insolenter tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laete an severe dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 40</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:45:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 45, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque refert cujusquam Punicas Romanasve acies laetius extuleris,</quote> <trans><tr>more eagerly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ausi laetius aut licentius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetissime gaudere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.20" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fruitfully, abundantly, luxuriantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges laete virens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 27, § 89</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncus laetius frondet,</quote> <trans><tr>more fruitfully, more luxuriantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:9:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25653.21" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lightly, not severely, without seriousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis putet nos laetius fecisse quam orationis severitas exigat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25654" type="main" key="laetus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laetus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, in late Lat., <sense id="n25654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foreign bondman who received a piece of land to cultivate, for which he paid tribute to his master, a serf</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eum.</author> Pan. 21, 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25654.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">laeta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the land so cultivated</hi>, Cod. Th. 7, 20, 10.—</sense><sense id="n25654.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">laetĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> laetus: laeticae terrae, Cod. Th. 13, 11, 9.</sense></entryFree>
laeva: <entryFree id="n25655" type="main" key="laeva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laeva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the left hand</hi>, v. laevus, I. B. 1.</sense></entryFree>
laevatus: <entryFree id="n25656" type="main" key="laeva_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laevātus</orth>, v. levatus.</entryFree>
laeve: <entryFree id="n25657" type="main" key="laeve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laevē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> v. laevus <sense id="n25657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
laevi: <entryFree id="n25658" type="main" key="Laevi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laevi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lēvi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Lævi, an ancient people of Liguria, between the Po and the Ticinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 37, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 35, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laevianus: <entryFree id="n25659" type="main" key="Laevi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laevĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Laevius, II.</entryFree>
laevigatio: <entryFree id="n25660" type="main" key="laevi^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laevĭgātĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">laevĭgātor</orth>, v. levig-.</entryFree>
laevinus: <entryFree id="n25661" type="main" key="Laevi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laevīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>laeva</etym>, <sense id="n25661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Valeria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 8</bibl>. Esp. </sense><sense id="n25661.1" n="1" level="3"> M. Valerius Laevinus, <hi rend="ital">consul during the second Punic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25661.2" n="2" level="3"> C. Valerius Laevinus, <hi rend="ital">prætor and consul about</hi> B. C. 180, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 44, 2</bibl>; ib. § 7.—</sense><sense id="n25661.3" n="3" level="3"> P. Valerius Laevinus, <hi rend="ital">lampooned by Horace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laevis: <entryFree id="n25662" type="main" key="laevis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laevis</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">laevĭtas</orth>, v. 1. levis, etc.</entryFree>
laevius: <entryFree id="n25663" type="main" key="Laevi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laevĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman poet of the ante-clussical period</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:7" default="NO">19, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Edyll. 13</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25663.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laevĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the poet Lævius, Lævian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laevorsum: <entryFree id="n25664" type="main" key="laevorsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laevorsum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">laevorsus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>laevus-versum</etym>, <sense id="n25664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">on the left hand, to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">towards the left</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">laevorsum vel dextrorsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 1, p. 340, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=117" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 117</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevorsus flexus itinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 10, 11 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
