laevus: <entryFree id="n25665" type="main" key="laevus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">laevus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">laio/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n25665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">left, on the left side</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn.: sinister,<cb n="LAGE" />  scaevus). </sense><sense id="n25665.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ut idem nunc sit laevus; <cit><quote lang="la">et e laevo sit mutua dexter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 301</bibl></cit> (325): <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab laeva manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: habeo equidem hercle oculum. <hi rend="ital">Py.</hi> At laevom dico, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:7:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 415</bibl></cit>: auris <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:336" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 336</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pontus,</quote> <trans><tr>lying to the left</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 9, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habena,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <trans><tr>the left bank</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevā in parte mamillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 159</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25665.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25665.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">laeva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n25665.4" n="(a)" level="5"> (Sc. manus.) <hi rend="ital">The left hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opsecro te hanc per dexteram, perque hanc sororem laevam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ilionea petit dextrā, laevāque Serestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 611</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 552</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 188: cognovi clipeum laevae gestamina nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:782" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 782</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">8, 321: hinc factum est ut usus anulorum exemtus dexterae, in laevam relegaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dextera laevaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:561" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 561</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:658" default="NO">658</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25665.5" n="(b)" level="5"> (Sc. pars.) <hi rend="ital">The left side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevam cuncta cohors remis ventisque petivit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevam pete,</quote> <trans><tr>go to the left</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 642</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. <pos>adv.</pos>: laevā, <hi rend="ital">on the left side, on the left</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrā montibus, laevā Tiberi amne saeptus,</quote> <trans><tr>on the left</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrā laevāque duo maria claudunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 43</bibl></cit>: so, a laevā: Diana facem jacit a laeva, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 55 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 14, 22</bibl>.—So, ad laevam, in laevam, <hi rend="ital">to the left, on the left</hi>: ante, et pone; <cit><quote lang="la">ad laevam, et ad dexteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in laevam detorserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25665.6" n="2" level="3"> In <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: laevum, <hi rend="ital">on the left</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">intonuit laevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 693</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 631</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevum extendere comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:495" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 495</bibl></cit>: in laevum, adverbially, <hi rend="ital">to the left</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fleximus in laevum cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:17" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit in laevum conversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:120" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 120</bibl></cit> (Jahn, in laevam).— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laeva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">places lying on the left</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeva tenent Thetis et Melite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:825" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 825</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracen et laeva Propontidos intrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:257" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 257</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25665.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25665.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Awkward, stupid, foolish, silly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mens non laeva fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">o ego laevus, Qui purgor bilem sub verni temporis horam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 301</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25665.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Of ill omen, unfavorable, inconvenient; unfortunate, unlucky, bad, pernicious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirius laevo contristat lumine caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccatum fateor, cum te sic tempore laevo Interpellarim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque nec laevus vetat ire picus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 27, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevo monitu pueros producit avaros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:228" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:70" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a pestilence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:634" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 634</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Idyll. 2, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:464" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 464</bibl> Rupert; so, <cit><quote lang="la">numina laeva (opp. dextra or propitia),</quote> <trans><tr>unfavorable gods, hostile deities</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 7</bibl></cit> Jahn and Forbig. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">impia Cappadocum tellus et numine laevo Visa tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:85:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 85, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:494" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 494</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:512" default="NO">15, 512</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> adv. Gent. 3, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25665.10" n="C" level="2"> In the language of augurs, <hi rend="ital">fortunate, lucky, propitious</hi> (because the Romans, by turning their faces to the south, had the eastern signs on their left hand; <cit><quote lang="la">v. sinister): laeva prospera existimantur, quoniam laevā parte mundi ortus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 54, 55, § 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:18:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 18, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitru dedit omina laevo Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:833" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 833</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:693" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 693</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 631</bibl> (I. B. 2 supra).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">laevē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">awkwardly, wrongly</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lagaena: <entryFree id="n25666" type="main" key="la^gaena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. lagena.</entryFree>
laganum: <entryFree id="n25667" type="greek" key="la^ga^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/ganon</foreign>, <sense id="n25667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of cake made of flour and oil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:7:section=23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 7, § 23 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lagana azyma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 29, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,004:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Num. 6, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lagarina: <entryFree id="n25668" type="main" key="Lagari_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lagarīna</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <number>plur.</number> (sc. vina), <sense id="n25668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lagena: <entryFree id="n25669" type="greek" key="la^ge_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgēna</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgaena</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lăgoena</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgōna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/ghnos</foreign>, <sense id="n25669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large earthen vessel with a neck and handles, a flask, flagon, bottle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi tu lagenam dicas, ubi vinum solet Chium esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">81</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:271" default="NO">14, 271</bibl> et saep.—Also made of other materials, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 128</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syra nigri defruti,</quote> <trans><tr>of glass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:46:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 46, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lageos: <entryFree id="n25670" type="greek" key="la^ge_os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgēos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/geios</foreign>, <sense id="n25670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek species of vine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et passo Psithia utilior, tenuisque Lageos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 5, 16</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgēos</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 39</bibl></cit>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16, 7</bibl>. <pb n="1031" /> <cb n="LAMA" /></sense></entryFree>
lageus: <entryFree id="n25671" type="main" key="La_ge_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāgēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Lagus, II.</entryFree>
lago: <entryFree id="n25672" type="main" key="lago"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lago</orth>, <itype>inis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise called schite; <cit><quote lang="la">and scammonia tenuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 89, § 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lagoena: <entryFree id="n25673" type="main" key="la^goena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgoena</orth>, v. lăgēna <sense id="n25673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lagois: <entryFree id="n25674" type="greek" key="la^go_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgōis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lagwi+(s</foreign>, <sense id="n25674.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of bird</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">heath-cock, grouse</hi> (or the same as lagopus, <hi rend="ital">white grouse</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">peregrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; Schol. Cruq. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
lagon: <entryFree id="n25675" type="main" key="La_go_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāgōn</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a boy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos facimus Bruti puerum, nos Lagona vivum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:51:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 51, 5</bibl></cit> (al. Langona).</sense></entryFree>
lagona:
<entryFree id="n25676" type="main" key="la^go_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgōna</orth>, v. lagena <sense id="n25676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>
(† <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgŏnŏpŏnos</orth>, <itype>false reading for adligato raphano</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 4, 13, § 24</bibl>.)</sense></entryFree>
lagophthalmos: <entryFree id="n25677" type="greek" key="la^gophthalmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgophthalmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lagwfqalmo/s</foreign> (hare-eye), <sense id="n25677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a person afflicted with a disease of the eye, in which the upper lid does not cover the eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:9:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 9, § 93</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
lagopus: <entryFree id="n25678" type="main" key="la^go_pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăgōpūs</orth>, <itype>ŏdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lagw/pous</foreign>, <sense id="n25678.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hare'sfoot</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25678.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Alpine bird</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">white grouse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 48, 68, § 133</bibl> (see also glaucopis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:87" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 87</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n25678.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The herb hare's-foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 34, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lagos: <entryFree id="n25679" type="main" key="Lagos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lagos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Great Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laguncula: <entryFree id="n25680" type="main" key="la^guncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăguncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lagena</etym>, <sense id="n25680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small flask, small bottle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 6, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 32, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">48, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laguncularis: <entryFree id="n25681" type="hapax" key="la^guncu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăguncŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laguncula</etym>, <sense id="n25681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a small bottle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lagunculus: <entryFree id="n25682" type="hapax" key="la^guncu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăguncŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of pastry</hi> (al. lucunculus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:17" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lagus: <entryFree id="n25683" type="main" key="La_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25683.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Ptolemy I. king of Egypt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regia Lagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famosa moenia Lagi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:83" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina Lagi, i. e. Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:592" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 592</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25683.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāgēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lagus, Lagian</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Egyptian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 684</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:196" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:26:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 26, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:322" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 322</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laiades: <entryFree id="n25684" type="main" key="La_i^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Laius, II.</entryFree>
laicus: <entryFree id="n25685" type="greek" key="la_i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">lai+ko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n25685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the people</hi> or <hi rend="ital">laity, not priestly, not consecrated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non habeo laicos panes,</quote> <trans><tr>loaves not consecrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 21, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lāĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a layman, laic, one not belonging to the priesthood</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. ad Castit. 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. clericus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Lucif. 3 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
lais: <entryFree id="n25686" type="main" key="La_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis and ĭdos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lai+(s</foreign>, <sense id="n25686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two courtesans of Corinth celebrated for their beauty</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25686.1" n="I" level="1"> Lais, who flourished during the Peloponnesian war: <cit><quote lang="la">dicitur et multis Lais amata viris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 2</bibl> (<case>acc.</case> Laida); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 1</bibl> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Laidos).—</sense><sense id="n25686.2" n="II" level="1"> Lais, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Demosthenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 8, 3</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 81</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laidas et Glyceras, lascivae nomina famae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 18, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laius: <entryFree id="n25687" type="main" key="La_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lajus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<case>voc.</case> Lai, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:355" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 355</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/ios</foreign>, <sense id="n25687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Labdacus, king of Thebes, and father of Œdipus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:33:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 33, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">66</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Laius</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Œdipus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 759</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lalage: <entryFree id="n25688" type="main" key="La^la^ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lălăgē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lalagh/</foreign>, <sense id="n25688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 16</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of a woman</hi>: LIVIA LALAGE, Inscr. ap. Mur. 1367, 1.</sense></entryFree>
laletania: <entryFree id="n25689" type="main" key="La^le_ta_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lălētānĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">where the vine was cultivated</hi>, Ep. Pompei ad Senat. 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fragm. 2:96:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. Fragm. 2, 96, 5</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:22" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 50, 22</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lălētānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Laletania, Laletanian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 71</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lălētāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Laletania, Laletanians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 21</bibl> (dub.; al. Lacetani).</sense></entryFree>
lalisio: <entryFree id="n25690" type="foreign" key="la_li_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lālīsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (African), <sense id="n25690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the foal of a wild ass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 174</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:97" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lallo: <entryFree id="n25691" type="main" key="lallo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lallo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n25691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to sing lalla</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lullaby, to sing as a nurse to a child</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratus mammae, lallare recusas,</quote> <trans><tr>will not let yourself be sung to sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:17" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 14, 3</bibl>: lallare <foreign lang="greek">baba/zein</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lallum: <entryFree id="n25692" type="main" key="lallum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lallum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lallus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lallo</etym>, <sense id="n25692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a singing lalla</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lullaby</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lama: <entryFree id="n25693" type="main" key="la_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (cf.: lacus, lacer). <sense id="n25693.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> <cb n="LAME" /> <hi rend="ital">slough, bog, fen</hi>: lacuna id est aquae collectio, quam alii lamam, alii lustrum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=117" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 117</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">viribus uteris per clivos, flumina, lamas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25693.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of mastic</hi>: Pistacia lentiscus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 36, § 72</bibl> (al. lainam).</sense></entryFree>
lambdacismus: <entryFree id="n25694" type="main" key="lambda^cismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lambdăcismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. labdacismus.</entryFree>
lambero: <entryFree id="n25695" type="main" key="lambe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lambĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n25695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to tear to pieces</hi> (ante-class.): lamberat scindit ac laniat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">lepide, Charine, meo me ludo lamberas,</quote> <trans><tr>you beat me at my own game, pay me in my own coin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lambito: <entryFree id="n25696" type="hapax" key="lambi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lambĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>lambo</etym>, <sense id="n25696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lick, lap up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptii canes e Nilo numquam nisi currentes lambitant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lambitus: <entryFree id="n25697" type="hapax" key="lambi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lambĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a licking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupam primo lambitu pueros detersisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. Gentis R. 20" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. Gentis R. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lambo: <entryFree id="n25698" type="main" key="lambo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lambo</orth>, <itype>bi, bitum</itype> (<sense id="n25698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> lambuerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:7:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jud. 7, 7 al.</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root lap-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la/ptw, lafu/ssw</foreign>; Lat. labrum, labium; Germ. Löffel, spoon; Eng. lip</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lick, lap; to touch</hi> (class.; cf.: lingo, sugo, ligurio). </sense><sense id="n25698.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi canes, quos tribunal meum vides lambere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lagonae collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lambent cibos (pisces),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:30:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:48:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 48, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crustula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 5</bibl></cit>: jucundasque puer qui lamberat ore placentas, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 10, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lambent sanguinem,</quote> <trans><tr>to lick up, to lap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 21, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Judic. 7, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te gurgite mersum unda feret, piscesque inpastivulnera lambent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 560</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25698.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a river, <hi rend="ital">to flow by, to wash, bathe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel quae loca fabulosus Lambit Hydaspes,</quote> <trans><tr>washes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 22, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of fire, <hi rend="ital">to lick, to reach, play upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma summum properabat lambere tectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">innoxia mollis Lambere flamma comas (Iuli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:684" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aetna attollit globos flammarum et sidera lambit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 574</bibl></cit>.—Of the ivy: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum imagines lambunt hederae sequaces,</quote> <trans><tr>to encircle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 5" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tedia non lambit Cluviam,</quote> <trans><tr>caress, fondle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:49" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunal unius legati,</quote> <trans><tr>to fawn upon, court</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 120, 1</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
lambrica: <entryFree id="n25699" type="main" key="Lambri_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lambrīca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lambrus: <entryFree id="n25700" type="main" key="Lambrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lambrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in northern Italy, a tributary of the Po</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:131 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 131 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
lamella: <entryFree id="n25701" type="main" key="la_mella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lamina</etym>, <sense id="n25701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small plate of metal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucae lamellae argenti,</quote> <trans><tr>a few small silver coins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 21:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brev. Vit. 12, 2</bibl>: stella e lamella aerea, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=351" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 351</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lamellula: <entryFree id="n25702" type="hapax" key="la_mellu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmellŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lamella</etym>, <sense id="n25702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small plate of metal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebulas emi, lamellulas paravi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lamenta: <entryFree id="n25703" type="main" key="la_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (collat. form of lamentum, q. v.): lamentas, fletus facere, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 132, 28</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 175 Rib.).</entryFree>
lamentabilis: <entryFree id="n25704" type="main" key="la_menta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmentābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lamentor</etym>, <sense id="n25704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mournful, lamentable</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n25704.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Full of sorrow, expressing sorrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">afflictus et jacens, et lamentabili voce deplorans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25704.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Causing sorrow, deplorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera sumptuosa et lamentabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 25, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tributum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 263</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lamentarius: <entryFree id="n25705" type="hapax" key="la_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lamentum</etym>, <sense id="n25705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mournful, causing tears</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lamentatio: <entryFree id="n25706" type="main" key="la_menta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lamentor</etym>, <sense id="n25706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wailing, moaning, weeping, lamenting, lamentation</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">querela, questus, lamentum, plangor, planctus): lamentatio (est) aegritudo, cum ejulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudo, lacrumae, lamentatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lugubris fletusque maerens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plangore et lamentatione complerimus forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 38, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:21:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 21, § 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidianae virginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:17:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(funeris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox lamentationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 9, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25706.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <number>plur.</number> (in eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Lamentationes,</quote> <trans><tr>title of the book of afflictions, written by the prophet Jeremiah</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> Paral. 35, 25 al.</sense></entryFree>
lamentator: <entryFree id="n25707" type="gloss" key="la_menta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmentātor</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">qrhnhth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
lamentatrix: <entryFree id="n25708" type="main" key="la_menta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmentātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lamentator</etym>, <sense id="n25708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who bewails</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 9, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lamento: <entryFree id="n25709" type="main" key="la_mento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmento</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (collat. form of lamentor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 11, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 7, 32</bibl>. <cb n="LAMI" /></entryFree>
lamentor: <entryFree id="n25710" type="main" key="la_mentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmentor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n25710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [lamentum], <hi rend="ital">to wail, moan, weep, lament</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n25710.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentari, cruciari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nunc lamentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter ceteras lamentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides flere ac lamentari cogere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hebiliter lamentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac plangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>: quid ego hic animo lamentor, Enn. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 4, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 210 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">Thetis quoque lamentando pausam fecit filio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25710.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to weep over</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to bewail, lament, bemoan</hi>: conqueri fortunam advorsam, non lamentari decet, Id viri est officium; fletus muliebri ingenio additus est, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 50</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 268 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">nam haec quidem vita mors est, quam lamentari possem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 38, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suam matrem mortuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nemo ad lamentandam tanti imperii calamitatem relinquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object.clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 79</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum lamentamur, non apparere labores Nostros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 224</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25710.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.; cf. lamento).—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi> in pass. signif. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">wept over, bewailed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fata per urbem Lamentata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:711" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 711</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Dindyma,</quote> <trans><tr>resounding with lamentations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:224" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 224</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25710.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeretur, fletur, lamentatur diebus plusculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lamentum: <entryFree id="n25711" type="main" key="la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. for clamentum, from clamo</etym>, <sense id="n25711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wailing, moaning, weeping, lamentation, lament</hi> (class., only in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 242</bibl></cit> Lachm.: <cit><quote lang="la">negat se velle mortem suam dolore amicorum et lamentis vacare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 20, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se lamentis lacrimisque dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentis lacrimisque extinctos prosequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamenta ac lacrimas cito ponunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sordibus, lamentis luctuque jacēre, Cis. Pis. 36, 88: lamentis gemituque et femineo ululatu Tecta fremunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 667</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per lamenta ... muliebriter ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 28</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of hens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 55, 76, § 155</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assume super Syrum lamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 27, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:9:20 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 9, 20 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
lamia: <entryFree id="n25712" type="greek" key="la^mi^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lămĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lami/a</foreign>. <sense id="n25712.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A witch</hi> who was said to suck children's blood, <hi rend="ital">a sorceress, enchantress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu pransae lamiae vivum puerum extrahat alvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 340</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 110, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5</bibl>, p. 164, 6.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamiae turres,</quote> <trans><tr>nursery tales</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25712.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of flatfish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 24, 40, § 78</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25712.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A species of owl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 34, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25713" type="main" key="La^mi^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lămĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Aelia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:385" default="NO">6, 385</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 1</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25713.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lămĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Lamia, Lamian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25714" type="main" key="La^mi^a3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lămĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lami/a</foreign>, <sense id="n25714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Phthiotis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Zeitun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 14, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lamina: <entryFree id="n25715" type="main" key="la_mi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmĭna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lammĭna</orth>, and sync. <orth extent="full" lang="la">lamna</orth> (e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:123" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9</bibl>; also, <sense id="n25715.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">lamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a thin piece of metal, wood, marble</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">a plate, leaf, layer, lamina</hi> [root la, = <foreign lang="greek">e)la</foreign>- of <foreign lang="greek">e)lau/nw</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">e)lato/s</foreign>]. </sense><sense id="n25715.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum lamina esset inventa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna laminis clavisque religant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cataphracta rum tegimen ferreis laminis consertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex argento laminas ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 9, 45, § 128</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aes in laminas tenuare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 20, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa in laminas secare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuem nimium laminam ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argutae lamina serrae,</quote> <trans><tr>the blade of a saw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 143</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">of a knife</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 6, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">of a sword</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 173</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 488</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">doliorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>staves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 64, § 236</bibl></cit> (Jahn, lanas): <cit><quote lang="la">laminae aëneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 38, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25715.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25715.3" n="A" level="2"> Laminae ardentes, <hi rend="ital">red-hot plates</hi>, instruments of torture for slaves, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">candens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 36</bibl></cit>; without <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">advorsum laminas, crucesque conpedisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1017" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1017</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25715.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Money coin</hi>: et levis argenti lamina crimen<pb n="1032" /> <cb n="LAMP" />  erat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:209" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 209</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fulva,</quote> <trans><tr>a gold piece, gold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicus lamnae,</quote> <trans><tr>foe to money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuas opes ... laminas utriusque materiae,</quote> <trans><tr>of each precious metal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25715.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A saw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25715.6" n="D" level="2"> Aurium, <hi rend="ital">the flap of the ear</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurium laminae frigescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:198" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 198</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25715.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The tender shell of an unripe nut</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Nux, 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lamium: <entryFree id="n25716" type="main" key="la_mi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāmĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dead-nettle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 55, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 14, 16, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lamna: <entryFree id="n25717" type="main" key="lamna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lamna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. lamina <sense id="n25717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lamnula: <entryFree id="n25718" type="main" key="lamnu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lamnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lamina</etym> for lamella, <sense id="n25718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little plate of metal</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">triumphi laurea lamnulis ornatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Coron. Mil. 12</bibl></cit> dub. (al. lamnis).</sense></entryFree>
lampabilis: <entryFree id="n25719" type="main" key="lampa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lampābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lampo</etym>, <sense id="n25719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">shining</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Cassiod. in Psa. praef. 17.</sense></entryFree>
lampada: <entryFree id="n25720" type="main" key="lampa^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lampăda</orth>, v. lampas <sense id="n25720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lampadarius: <entryFree id="n25721" type="main" key="lampa^da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lampădārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lampas</etym>, <sense id="n25721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lampbearer, torch-bearer</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 60, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2930</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2845</bibl> (called in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>, servus praelucens).</sense></entryFree>
lampadias: <entryFree id="n25722" type="greek" key="lampa^di^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lampădĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lampadi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n25722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comet resembling a blazing torch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lampadio: <entryFree id="n25723" type="main" key="Lampadio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampadio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lampadiscus: <entryFree id="n25724" type="main" key="Lampa^discus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampădiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lampado: <entryFree id="n25725" type="main" key="lampa^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lampădo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, i. q. bulbus, Theod. Prisc. de Diaeta, 9.</entryFree>
lampas: <entryFree id="n25726" type="greek" key="lampa^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lampăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype> (late Lat. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">lampă-da</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. G. Alex. 3:28" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. G. Alex. 3, 28</bibl>: <sense id="n25726.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">lampadarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 1, 13</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lampa/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a light, torch, flambeau</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; cf.: lucerna, lychnus, laterna). </sense><sense id="n25726.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampades ardentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: illatae lampades, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampadas igniferas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi argenteum Cupidinem cum lampade,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:47:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 47, § 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pingues lampades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 535</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Salmoneus, dum flammas Jovis imitatur, lampada quassans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampadibus densum rapuit funale coruscis,</quote> <trans><tr>with torches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 247</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:20:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 20, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampas ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 15, 17</bibl></cit>.—Used at weddings, <hi rend="ital">a wedding-torch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tene hane lampadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 9</bibl>. —Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampade primā,</quote> <trans><tr>at her wedding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:8:59" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 8, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25726.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a lamp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferreae lampades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aënea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:285" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecinctae lampades auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere oleum cum lampadibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 25, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25726.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25726.4" n="A" level="2"> From the Grecian torch-race (which consisted in keeping the torch burning during the race and handing it, still lighted, to the next one), are borrowed the expressions: lampada tradere alicui, <hi rend="ital">to give</hi> or <hi rend="ital">resign one's occupation to another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc cursu lampada tibi trado,</quote> <trans><tr>now it is your turn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quasi cursores, vitai lampada tradunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>they finish their course, die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui prior es, cur me in decursu lampada poscis?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>do you wish to succeed to my estate while I am yet alive?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:61" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25726.5" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">splendor, brightness, lustre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeterna mundl,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 402</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rosea sol alte lampade lucens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:610" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebeae lampadis instar,</quote> <trans><tr>the light of the sun, the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postera cum primā lustrabat lampade terras Orta dies,</quote> <trans><tr>the first beams of light, first rays of dawn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25726.6" n="C" level="2"> Hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, like lumen, for <hi rend="ital">day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">octavoque fere candenti lumine solis Aut etiam nonā reddebant lampade vitam,</quote> <trans><tr>on the ninth day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1198</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the moonlight: decima lampas Phoebes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:366" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 366</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se bina formavit lampade Phoebe,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>after two moons</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lampade Phoebes sub decima,</quote> <trans><tr>the tenth month</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:366" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 366</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25726.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A meteor resembling a torch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emicant et faces, non nisi cum decidunt visae. Duo genera earum: lampades vocant plane faces, alterum bolidas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 25, § 96</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc sparso lumine lampas emicuit caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 532</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:502" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 502</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lampetie: <entryFree id="n25727" type="main" key="Lampe^ti^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampĕtĭē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lampeti/h</foreign>, <sense id="n25727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of the sun-god and sister of Phaëthon, who was changed into a tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 154" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12</bibl> (4, 11), 29.</sense></entryFree>
lampetra: <entryFree id="n25728" type="gloss" key="lampetra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lampetra</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">mu/raina</foreign>, <sense id="n25728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lamprey</hi>, Gloss. Philox. <cb n="LANA" /></sense></entryFree>
lampia: <entryFree id="n25729" type="main" key="Lampi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampīa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:290" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 290</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lampo: <entryFree id="n25730" type="hapax" key="lampo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lampo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>lampas</etym>, <sense id="n25730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to shine</hi> (eccl. Lat.); <cit><quote lang="la">only trop. of eloquence,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lampon: <entryFree id="n25731" type="main" key="Lampon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/mpwn</foreign>, <sense id="n25731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:334" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 334</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lampridius: <entryFree id="n25732" type="main" key="Lampri^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lamprĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n25732.0" n="I" level="1"> Aelius, <hi rend="ital">a Roman historiographer, one of the</hi> Scriptores Historiae Augustae, Vopisc. Prob. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. Teuffel, Gesch. der Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 397, 4.— </sense><sense id="n25732.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Latin orator of the fifth century</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>; cf. Teuffel, Gesch. der Röm. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> § 459, 6.</sense></entryFree>
lampsacum: <entryFree id="n25733" type="main" key="Lampsa^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampsăcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampsă-cus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/myakos</foreign>, <sense id="n25733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Mysia, on the Hellespont</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lamsaki</hi>. —Form Lampsacum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19</bibl>.—Form Lampsacus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:624" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 624</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:26" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 26</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25733.1" n="II" level="1"> </sense><sense id="n25733.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampsăcēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lampsacum, Lampsacene</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>inhabitants of Lampsacum, Lampsacenes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:24:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 24, § 63</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampsăcēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Lampsacum, the Lampsacenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:32:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 32, § 81</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25733.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampsăcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lampsacum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>obscene</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:16:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:51:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 51, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lampsana: <entryFree id="n25734" type="main" key="lampsa^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lampsăna</orth>, v. lapsana.</entryFree>
lampus: <entryFree id="n25735" type="main" key="Lampus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lampus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n25735.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of Actæon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25735.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the four horses of the sun</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lampyris: <entryFree id="n25736" type="greek" key="lampy_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lampȳris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lampuri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n25736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glowworm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lamus: <entryFree id="n25737" type="main" key="La^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/mos</foreign>. <sense id="n25737.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mythic king of the Læstrygonians, a son of Neptune, and the founder of Formiæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:530" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 530</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, urbs Lami,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Formiæ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 233</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25737.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Hercules and Omphale</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25737.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:474" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 474</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lamyrus: <entryFree id="n25738" type="greek" key="la^my^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lămyrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/muros</foreign>, <sense id="n25738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seafish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:120" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl> (Jahn, larinus).</sense></entryFree>
lana: <entryFree id="n25739" type="main" key="la_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la/xnh, la/xnos, lh=nos</foreign>, Dor. <foreign lang="greek">la=nos</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">la/oios</foreign>, and v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=113" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 113</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n25739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam cārĕre,</quote> <trans><tr>to card wool</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lanam trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:54" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:224" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanas ducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to spin wool</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam expediendam conducere,</quote> <trans><tr>for carding and spinning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:8:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanas tingere murice,</quote> <trans><tr>to dye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam fucare veneno Assyrio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicata fuco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea lana,</quote> <trans><tr>the golden fleece</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:876" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 876</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana legata, sive succida sive lota sit, sive pectinata sive versicoloria, legato cedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 82</bibl></cit>;
