cf. <cit><quote lang="la">§ 85: si ex lana mea vestimentum feceris, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:79" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 79</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25739.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25739.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a working in wool</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana et tela victum quaeritans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lucretia lanae dedita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">te lanae ... non citharae decent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admotaque lanis quae cessat acu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:497" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 497</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: cogitare de lana sua, <hi rend="ital">to be thinking about her work</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be unconcerned</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 686</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25739.3" n="B" level="2"> Of things resembling wool, <hi rend="ital">soft hair</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feathers, down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana leporina et anserina et caprina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:70" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:161" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 161</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">celantur simili ventura Cydonia lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 10, 21, § 38</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">thin, fleecy clouds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuia lanae vellera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 397</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 82, § 356</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">rixari de lana caprina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to dispute about trifles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanaris: <entryFree id="n25740" type="hapax" key="la_na_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lana</etym>, <sense id="n25740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woolly, woolbearing</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanarius: <entryFree id="n25741" type="main" key="la_na_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to wool, wool-</hi> (post-Aug.; cf.: lanifer, laniger, lamificus, lanatus). </sense><sense id="n25741.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <trans><tr>fuller's-weed, soapwort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 18, 105, § 169</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:35" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25741.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25741.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a worker in wool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 34</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 70</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Firm. Math. 8, 19: ‡ lanarius coactiliarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a maker of fulled stuffs, a fuller</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">‡ lanarius pectinarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a woolcarder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4207</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25741.4" n="B" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wool-factory, wool-spinning establishment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3303</bibl>. <cb n="LANE" /></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25742" type="main" key="La_na_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lānārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the surname of</hi> P. Calpurnius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanatus: <entryFree id="n25743" type="main" key="la_na_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lana</etym>, <sense id="n25743.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with wool, bearing wool, woolly</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n25743.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanatae oves,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unshorn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de lanata pelle,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 42, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:11" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">wool-bearers</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">sheep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 155</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25743.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <trans><tr>downy, covered with down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 14, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus,</quote> <trans><tr>soft like wool</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 17, 28, § 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia lanatiore canitie,</quote> <trans><tr>white like wool</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 20, 84, § 147</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">dii lanatos pedes habent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the vengeance of the gods comes noiselessly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25744" type="main" key="La_na_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lānātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25744.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname in the</hi> gens Menenia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lancea: <entryFree id="n25745" type="main" key="lance^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">lo/gxh</foreign>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll.; acc. to Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:30" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>, of Spanish origin</etym>, <sense id="n25745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a light spear, with a leather thong fastened to the middle of it, a lance, spear</hi> (cf.: telum, spiculum, hastile, pilum, jaculum, etc.): Suevi lanceis configunt, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 556, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lancea infesta ... medium femur trajecit voluseni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 4:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 4, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceteri sparos aut lanceas portabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanus miles missili pilo aut lanceis assultans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lata,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with a broad head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 375</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus torta manu commisit lancea bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 472</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec, duas lanceas dextra praeferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi non parvam incussisti sollicitudinem, injecto non scrupulo, sed lancea, ne sermones nostros anus illa cognoscat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>great dread</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 107, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lancearius: <entryFree id="n25746" type="main" key="lance^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĕārĭus</orth>, v. lanciarius.</entryFree>
lanceatus: <entryFree id="n25747" type="main" key="lance^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lancea</etym>, <sense id="n25747.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made into a lance, lance-formed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armabitur ferro et ligno lanceato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit>, Reg. 23, 7.</sense></entryFree>
lanceo: <entryFree id="n25748" type="main" key="lance^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĕo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lancea</etym>, <sense id="n25748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wield</hi> or <hi rend="ital">handle a lance</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanceola: <entryFree id="n25749" type="main" key="lance^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĕŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lancĭŏla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small lance</hi>, Capitol. Maxim. jun. 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanceolatus: <entryFree id="n25750" type="hapax" key="lance^o^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĕŏlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lanceola</etym>, <sense id="n25750.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">armed with a little lance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">point, lanceolated, lanceolate</hi>: plantago, Macer de Plantagine, 5.</sense></entryFree>
lances: <entryFree id="n25751" type="main" key="lances"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lances</orth>, v. lanx.</entryFree>
lancia: <entryFree id="n25752" type="main" key="Lanci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lancĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25752.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now <hi rend="ital">Castro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12</bibl>; cf. Mann. Hispan. p. 358.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lancĭen-ses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Lancia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25752.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city of the same name in</hi> Lusitania, <hi rend="ital">whose inhabitants were called</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lancĭenses</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 118</bibl>; cf. Mann. Hispan. p. 335.</sense></entryFree>
lanciarius: <entryFree id="n25753" type="main" key="lanci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĭārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lancĕār-</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lancea</etym>, <sense id="n25753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lancer</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 13, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:23:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 23, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lancicula: <entryFree id="n25754" type="main" key="lanci^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lanx</etym>, <sense id="n25754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small dish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">platter</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lancinator: <entryFree id="n25755" type="hapax" key="lanci^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lancino</etym>, <sense id="n25755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that tears to pieces, a render, lacerater</hi>: gregum, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1057.</sense></entryFree>
lancino: <entryFree id="n25756" type="main" key="lanci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. lacer</etym>, <sense id="n25756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear to pieces, to rend, mangle, lacerate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n25756.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium ira in cubili suo confodit ... alium intra leges celebrisque spectaculum fori lancinavit, Sen. de Ira, 1, 2, 2: morsu aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 5, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux membratim lancinatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot sinus Pelopennesi oram lancinant,</quote> <trans><tr>indent, cut up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 9, § 19</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25756.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy, consume, waste</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 29, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam (al. lanciniare),</quote> <trans><tr>to fritter away, waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 32:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credulitatem facetiis jocularibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanciola: <entryFree id="n25757" type="main" key="lanci^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancĭŏla</orth>, v. lanceola.</entryFree>
lancula: <entryFree id="n25758" type="main" key="lancu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lancŭla</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">langŭla</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:25:34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 25, 34</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lanx</etym>, <sense id="n25758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small balance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
landica: <entryFree id="n25759" type="gloss" key="landica"><orth extent="full" lang="la">landica</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">e)sxara/din</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
lanerum: <entryFree id="n25760" type="gloss" key="lanerum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lanerum</orth>, <itype>vestimenti genus ex lana sucida confectum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
lanestris: <entryFree id="n25761" type="hapax" key="la_nestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lana</etym>, <sense id="n25761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woollen, of wool</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 29, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laneus: <entryFree id="n25762" type="main" key="la_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woollen, of wool</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25762.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culcita ob oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:487" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 487</bibl></cit>: thorax subuculae, Suet. <pb n="1033" /> <cb n="LANG" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:82" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma flaminis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>his woollen fillet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:183" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 183</bibl></cit>: effigies, <hi rend="ital">little woollen figures which were distributed at the Compitalia</hi>, acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=121" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 121</bibl> Müll.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: dii irati laneos pedes habent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the vengeance of the gods comes unperceived</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 44, v. 789</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25762.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25762.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Covered with a woolly sub stance, downy;</hi> of fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">pira corio laneo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 55</bibl></cit> (Jahn et Corrolana).— </sense><sense id="n25762.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Soft like wool, woolly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupus,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of fish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:89:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 89, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latusculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
langa: <entryFree id="n25763" type="foreign" key="langa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">langa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Celtic</etym>, <sense id="n25763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of lizard, from whose urine the stone called</hi> langurium (lyncurium) <hi rend="ital">was said to be produced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
langobardi: <entryFree id="n25764" type="main" key="Lango^bardi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Langŏbardi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of northern Germany, west of the Elbe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens etiam Germana feritate ferocior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:106:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 106, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
languefacio: <entryFree id="n25765" type="hapax" key="langue^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">languĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>langueo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n25765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make faint, weary, languid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incitare languentes et languefacere excitatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
languens: <entryFree id="n25766" type="main" key="languens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">languens</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. langueo <sense id="n25766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
langueo: <entryFree id="n25767" type="main" key="langue^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">languĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root lag-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lagaro/s, la/gnos</foreign>, lewd; Lat. laxare, lactes; cf. Sanscr. lang-a, prostitute; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lagw/s</foreign>, hare, <foreign lang="greek">lago/nes</foreign>, the flanks, womb</etym>, <sense id="n25767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be faint, weary, languid</hi> (cf.: languesco, marceo, torpeo). </sense><sense id="n25767.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25767.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de via languerem,</quote> <trans><tr>was fatigued with my journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per assiduos motus languere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be wearied</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 161</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos languet,</quote> <trans><tr>droops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 2, 46; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:24 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 24 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">languet aequor,</quote> <trans><tr>the sea is calm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:30:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 30, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae languet jubar,</quote> <trans><tr>is enfeebled, obscured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:305" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 305</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25767.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to be weak, faint, languid</hi> from disease (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">languent mea membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristi languebunt corpora morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub natalem suum plerumque languebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl></cit>: si te languere audierimus, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego langui et aegrotavi per dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 10</bibl>; cf. languesco.—</sense><sense id="n25767.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be languid, dull, heavy, inactive, listless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">languet juventus, nec perinde atque debebat in laudis et gloriae cupiditate versatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:33:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 33, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eam solitudinem languere patior,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass in idleness, to be wasted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in otio hebescere et languere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si paululum modo vos languere viderint,</quote> <trans><tr>to be without energy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">languet amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi gratia languet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:361" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 361</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">languens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., faint, weak, feeble, inert, powerless, inactive, languid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incitare languentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: commovere languentem <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostris languentibus atque animo remissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: languenti stomacho esse, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">irritamentum Veneris languentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:167" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox languens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hyacinthus,</quote> <trans><tr>drooping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 69</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
languesco: <entryFree id="n25768" type="main" key="languesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">languesco</orth>, <itype>gŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n25768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [langueo], <hi rend="ital">to become faint, weak, languid</hi> (class.; syn.: torpesco, marcesco). </sense><sense id="n25768.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25768.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore languescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:24:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 24, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator metuo ne languescat senectute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:18" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites languescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 15, 37, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum flos, succisus aratro, languescit moriens,</quote> <trans><tr>droops, withers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 436</bibl></cit>: Bacchus in amphora Languescit, <hi rend="ital">becomes mild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mellow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna languescit,</quote> <trans><tr>becomes obscured</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color in luteum languescens,</quote> <trans><tr>inclining to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 109, § 133</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25768.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to be enfeebled</hi> by disease, <hi rend="ital">to be ill, to languish</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec mea languescent corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter omnino per quatuordecim annos languit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25768.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow languid, listless</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">inactive, to decline, decrease</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensus populi, si nos languescimus debilitetur necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martia legio hoc nuntio languescet et mollietur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare non est, cur eorum spes infringatur aut languescat industria,</quote> <trans><tr>should relax</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaria studia,</quote> <trans><tr>are on the decline</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:18" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens languescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: omnium rerum cupido languescit, <cb n="LANG" /> cum facilis occasio est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulatim atrocibus irae languescunt animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:325" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa rabies languit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 246</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
languide: <entryFree id="n25769" type="main" key="langui^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">languĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. languidus <sense id="n25769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
languidulus: <entryFree id="n25770" type="main" key="langui^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">languĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n25770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [languidus], <hi rend="ital">withered, faded</hi>. *</sense><sense id="n25770.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: coronae, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:66" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 66</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n25770.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus,</quote> <trans><tr>proceeding from faintness, languid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 332</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
languidus: <entryFree id="n25771" type="main" key="langui^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">languĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>langueo</etym>, <sense id="n25771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faint, weak, dull, sluggish, languid</hi> (class.; cf.: lassus, fessus, fatigatus, defessus). </sense><sense id="n25771.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25771.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">homines vino languidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vino vigiliisque languidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:12:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 12, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves Collo trahentes languido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:64" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 64</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">(oculi) languidi et torpentes,</quote> <trans><tr>dull</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 76</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus non languidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <trans><tr>sluggish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 17</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <trans><tr>gentle, mild;</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">carbasa,</quote> <trans><tr>hanging loose, not swelled out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <trans><tr>pale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 12, 26, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 17, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus venarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor piri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Novem. 7, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">languidioribus nostris vallum scindere (hostes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia languidiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 20, 24, § 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>more mellow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25771.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">faint, weak, languid</hi> from sickness, <hi rend="ital">languishing, ill</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): lumina, Laurea Tullius poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 3, § 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">languidior noster si quando est Paulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:86" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 122</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">languĭdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the sick man, invalid</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:14:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 14, 14 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25771.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">faint, feeble, powerless, inactive, listless</hi>, of persons and things: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus languida atque iners,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophus mollis, languidus, enervatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui antea aut alieniores fuerant aut languidiores,</quote> <trans><tr>more sluggish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:5:section=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 5, § 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos etiam languidiores postea facti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi beati, quos nullae futtiles laetitiae exultantes languidis liquefaciunt voluptatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse remisso ac languido animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">languidiore credo studio in causa fuistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio languidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas patrum,</quote> <trans><tr>weak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani ... fessi lassique erant: tamen instructi intentique obviam procedebant. Nam dolus Numidarum nihil languidi neque remissi patiebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos ubi languida pressit quies,</quote> <trans><tr>producing languor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:908" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 908</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">languĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a languid manner, faintly, feebly, slowly, languidly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">procedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmae languide dulces,</quote> <trans><tr>slightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 34</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">languidius in opere versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictum languidius,</quote> <trans><tr>more faintheartedly, spiritlessly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 25</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
languificus: <entryFree id="n25772" type="hapax" key="langui^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">languĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>langueofacio</etym>, <sense id="n25772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes faint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. in Versib. Q. Cic. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
langula: <entryFree id="n25773" type="main" key="langu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">langŭla</orth>, v. lancula.</entryFree>
languor: <entryFree id="n25774" type="main" key="languor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">languor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>langueo</etym>, <sense id="n25774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faintness, feebleness, weariness, sluggishness, languor, lassitude</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25774.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25774.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.; cf.: torpor, torpedo, veturnus): ubi saepe ad languorem tua duritia dederis octo validos lictores. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec deambulatio me ad languorem dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>has fatigued me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animus) cum languore corporis nec membris uti nec sensibus potest,</quote> <trans><tr>on account of lassitude of the body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:62:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 62, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">languore militum et vigiliis periculum augetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 31</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things, of the <hi rend="ital">faintness, paleness</hi> of colors, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 46, § 130</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the sea, <hi rend="ital">stillness, calmness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et maria pigro fixa languore impulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agm. 161" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agm. 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25774.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">faintness, weakness, languor</hi> proceeding from disease (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aquosus,</quote> <trans><tr>dropsy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">languor faucium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in languorem incidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsum languorem peperit cibus imperfectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:233" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere languores nostros ipse tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:53:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 53, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a languoribus sanari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 6, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25774.4" n="II" level="1"> <cb n="LANI" /> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">faintness, dulness, sluggishness, apathy, inactivity, listlessness</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">languori se desidiaeque dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">languorem afferre alicui, opp. acuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in languorem vertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amantem languor Arguit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:9" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:194" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
languria: <entryFree id="n25775" type="main" key="langu_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">langūrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of lizard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
langurium: <entryFree id="n25776" type="main" key="langu_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">langūrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of amber</hi>, also called lyncurium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 34</bibl>; cf. langa.</sense></entryFree>
laniamentum: <entryFree id="n25777" type="main" key="la^ni^a_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lanio</etym>, <sense id="n25777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing to pieces</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 2, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laniarius: <entryFree id="n25778" type="main" key="la^ni^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lanius</etym>, <sense id="n25778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a butcher</hi>.—Only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25778.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lă-nĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a butcher's stall</hi> (anteclass.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25778.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭā-rĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a butcher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> p. 1035</bibl>, n. 4.</sense></entryFree>
laniatio: <entryFree id="n25779" type="main" key="la^ni^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. lanio</etym>, <sense id="n25779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing in pieces, a mangling, lacerating</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">caedes hominum et laniationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laniator: <entryFree id="n25780" type="gloss" key="la^ni^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭātor</orth> <etym>id.</etym>, <foreign lang="greek">makella/rios</foreign>, <sense id="n25780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a butcher</hi>, i. q. lanius, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
laniatorium: <entryFree id="n25781" type="gloss" key="la^ni^a_to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭātōrĭum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">makellei=on, krewpwlei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n25781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a butcher's stall</hi>, i. q. laniena, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
laniatus: <entryFree id="n25782" type="main" key="la^ni^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. lanio</etym>, <sense id="n25782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing in pieces, a mangling, lacerating</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25782.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): ferarum, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">avium ferarumque laniatibus objectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid efferatius quam quod membra et artus debitoris brevissimo laniatu distrahantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25782.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">anguish, remorse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si recludantur tyrannorum mentes, posse adspici laniatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanicia: <entryFree id="n25783" type="main" key="la_ni^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭcĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, v. lanicius.</entryFree>
lanicius: <entryFree id="n25784" type="main" key="la_ni^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lana</etym>, <sense id="n25784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of wool, woolly, fleecy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 174</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭcĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (anteclass. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭcĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 22</bibl>; Com. Fragm. v. 67 Rib.; post-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭcĭes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Tert. adv. Marc. ap. Carm. 2, 24), <hi rend="ital">wool</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25784.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi lanicium curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 384</bibl></cit>: e lanicia Attica vestitus, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seres lanicio silvarum nobiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 17, 20, § 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:189" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 47, 72, § 189</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25784.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wool-bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fleecy cattle</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">form lanitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, p. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanicutis: <entryFree id="n25785" type="hapax" key="la_ni^cu^tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭcŭtis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lana-cutis</etym>, <sense id="n25785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woollyskinned</hi>: aries, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanienus: <entryFree id="n25786" type="main" key="la_ni^e_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lanius</etym>, <sense id="n25786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a butcher, butcher's</hi>: tabernae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 532, 20</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n25786.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A butcher's stall</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per myropolia et lanienas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanienae et tabernae conjunctae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n25786.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mangling, dissecting</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 497: <cit><quote lang="la">omnique laniena excruciatus,</quote> <trans><tr>torture, mutilation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanifer: <entryFree id="n25787" type="hapax" key="la_ni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lana-fero</etym>, <sense id="n25787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wool-bearing</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">cotton-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 14, 28, § 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanificium: <entryFree id="n25788" type="main" key="la_ni^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lanificus</etym>, <sense id="n25788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the working of wool</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">spinning, weaving</hi>, etc. (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">de lanificio neminem metuo, una aetate quae sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanificii curam suscipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">9: usum lanificii docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:8" default="NO">2, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam et neptes lanificio assuefacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanificus: <entryFree id="n25789" type="main" key="la_ni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lana-facio</etym>, <sense id="n25789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wool-working, that works in wool</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">spinning, weaving</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 382</bibl>: sorores, <hi rend="ital">the spinning sisters</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Fates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:58:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 58, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25789.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭfĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a wool-spinner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=5 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 5 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
laniger: <entryFree id="n25790" type="main" key="la_ni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕra, gĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lana-gero</etym>, <sense id="n25790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wool-bearing, fleecy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): pecus, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">greges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cottontrees</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 10, 21, § 38</bibl></cit>: fertilitas, of insects. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25790.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n25790.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a ram</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 312</bibl>. <pb n="1034" /> <cb n="LANN" /> —Of a lamb: <cit><quote lang="la">timens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—Of the constellation of <hi rend="ital">the Ram</hi>, for Aries, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 672</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 200 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25790.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭgĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a lamb, sheep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:703" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 703</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanilutor: <entryFree id="n25791" type="gloss" key="la_ni^lu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭlūtor</orth> <foreign lang="greek">e)rioplu/ths</foreign> (<sense id="n25791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wool-washer</hi>), Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
lanio: <entryFree id="n25792" type="main" key="la^ni^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. lacer, <foreign lang="greek">da/knw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n25792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rend in pieces, to mangle, lacerate</hi> (class.; cf.: lacero, discerpo, dilanio). </sense><sense id="n25792.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora a feris laniata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanianda viscera praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laniando dentibus hostem exspirare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 51, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foede crura brachiaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 398</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:174" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priamiden laniatum corpore toto vidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 494</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:678" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 678</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">Gr. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flavos Lavinia crinīs, Et roseas laniata genas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 606</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 139</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti mundum laniant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laniata classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 7, 175</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25792.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">et tua sacrilegae laniarunt carmina linguae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia cor laniant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 51:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 51, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25793" type="main" key="la^ni^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. lanio</etym>, <sense id="n25793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a butcher</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lanionis instrumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=24" default="NO">1, 2, 2, § 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tibi tunc, lanio, cernenti talia sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. 2, 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laniolum: <entryFree id="n25794" type="hapax" key="la^ni^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lanius</etym>, <sense id="n25794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little butcher's stall</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
lanionius: <entryFree id="n25795" type="main" key="la^ni^o_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a butcher</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <trans><tr>a butcher's stall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanipendens: <entryFree id="n25796" type="gloss" key="la_ni^pendens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭpendens</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">staqmou=xos, gunh\ h( to\n staqmo\n pare/xousa tai=s a)/llais</foreign>, <sense id="n25796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who weighs out wool for spinning, a spinning-mistress</hi>, Gloss. Philox.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2820</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanipendium: <entryFree id="n25797" type="main" key="la_ni^pendi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭpendĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lana-pendo</etym>, <sense id="n25797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the distribution of wool</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> Aul. Reg. ad Verg. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanipendius: <entryFree id="n25798" type="main" key="la_ni^pendi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭpendĭus</orth> (collat. form ‡<orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭ-pendus</orth>, Inscr. ap. Spon. Miscell. Antiq. p. 223; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Don.</author> Cl. 8, 57</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that weighs out wool, portions it out for spinning</hi> (post-class.); only as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n25798.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭpendĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who weighs out wool</hi>: lanipendius, <foreign lang="greek">staqmou=xos e)ridi/wn</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.—</sense><sense id="n25798.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭpendĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:476" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 476</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanipes: <entryFree id="n25799" type="hapax" key="la_ni^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭpēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lana-pes</etym>, <sense id="n25799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with wool on the feet</hi> (i. e. wrapped round), <hi rend="ital">woolfooted</hi>: senex, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 11, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanista: <entryFree id="n25800" type="main" key="la^nista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trainer of gladiators, fencing-master</hi> (class.; cf.: gladiator, athleta, pugil). </sense><sense id="n25800.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">num ille lanista omnino jam a gladiatore recessisse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reus, tamquam clemens lanista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regia verba lanistae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circumforaneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanistarum familias ex urbe expellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:215" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 215</bibl>.—So of fowls: <cit><quote lang="la">rixosarum avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25800.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an inciter, instigator, agitator; one who stimulates to wrong</hi> or <hi rend="ital">violence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic se ad eum lanistam contulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne videret unius corporis duas acies, lanista Cicerone, dimicantes. Ego lanista?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 19, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanistis Aetolis dimicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 33, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanistatura: <entryFree id="n25801" type="gloss" key="la^nista_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănistātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lanista</etym>, <sense id="n25801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the profession of a</hi> lanista, Inscr. Tab. Aen. Heracl. ap. Mazoch. p. 424, 49.</sense></entryFree>
lanisticius: <entryFree id="n25802" type="hapax" key="la^nisti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănistīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a trainer of gladiators</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">familia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. Trag. 45, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanitia: <entryFree id="n25803" type="main" key="la_ni^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānĭtĭa</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tiēs</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭum</orth>, v. lanicium.</entryFree>
lanius: <entryFree id="n25804" type="main" key="la^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lănĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. lanio</etym>, <sense id="n25804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a butcher</hi> (cf. macellarius): <cit><quote lang="la">lanii, qui concinnant liberis orbas ovīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetarii, lanii, coqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab lanio cultro arrepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de laniis aut vinariis ageretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 40 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an executioner</hi> (ante-class. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">arcesse hostias, victimas, lanios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 93</bibl></cit> and 98.—Abusively, <hi rend="ital">of a surgeon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Anim. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanivinus: <entryFree id="n25805" type="gloss" key="La_ni^vi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lānĭvīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lānĭvĭ-um</orth>, v. Lanuvium, II.</entryFree>
lannae: <entryFree id="n25806" type="gloss" key="lannae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lannae</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">loboi/</foreign>, <sense id="n25806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ear-flaps</hi>, Gloss. Philox. (sync. for laminae; v. lamina). <cb n="LANX" /></sense></entryFree>
lano: <entryFree id="n25807" type="gloss" key="la_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāno</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">e)riofore/w</foreign>, Gloss. Philox., <sense id="n25807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wear wool</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
lanoculus: <entryFree id="n25808" type="gloss" key="la_no^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>qui lana tegit oculi vitium</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
lanositas: <entryFree id="n25809" type="main" key="la_no_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lanosus</etym>, <sense id="n25809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woolliness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanosus: <entryFree id="n25810" type="main" key="la_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lana</etym>, <sense id="n25810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of wool, woolly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">uterus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vellus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanterna: <entryFree id="n25811" type="main" key="lanterna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lanterna</orth> (ante-class. and later <orth extent="full" lang="la">lā-terna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lampth/r</foreign>, root in <foreign lang="greek">la/mpw</foreign>; cf. Lat. limpidus, lepor, lepidus, lĕpus</etym>, <sense id="n25811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lantern, lamp, torch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a portu illic nunc cum laterna huc advenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterna Punica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linea lanterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic caulis olebit lanternam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:88" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 16, 16, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanternarius: <entryFree id="n25812" type="main" key="lanterna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lanternārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lanterna</etym>, <sense id="n25812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lantern-bearer, guide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanugineus: <entryFree id="n25813" type="main" key="la_nu_gi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānūgĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lanugo</etym>, for lanuginosus, <sense id="n25813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woolly, downy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanugino: <entryFree id="n25814" type="main" key="la_nu_gi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānūgĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>lanugo</etym>, <sense id="n25814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be of wool</hi> (late Lat.): lanuginans trama, Aug. in Job, 38.</sense></entryFree>
lanuginosus: <entryFree id="n25815" type="main" key="la_nu_gi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānūgĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lanugo</etym>, <sense id="n25815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woolly, downy</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">araneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vermiculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 15, 47, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanuginosa et aspera folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 45, § 83</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba lanuginosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 20, 24, § 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lanugo: <entryFree id="n25816" type="main" key="la_nu_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānūgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la/xnh</foreign>, Lat. lāna</etym>, <sense id="n25816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woolly substance, down</hi>, of plants, of the cheeks, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n25816.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flaventem primā ianugine malas Dum sequeris Clytium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 324</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">primaque par sacrae lanugo senectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:59" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">comae graciles et lanuginis instar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signarat dubia teneras lanugine malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 754</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a prima lanugine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba cubile praebebat, multa et molli lanugine abundans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:817" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 817</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia araneosa lanugine obducta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 12, 66, § 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cana legam tenera lanugine mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25816.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sawdust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lanula: <entryFree id="n25817" type="main" key="la_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lānŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lana</etym>, <sense id="n25817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little wool, a small lock of wool</hi> (perh. only in Celsus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 27, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
