lanuvium: <entryFree id="n25818" type="main" key="La_nu^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lānŭvĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Länĭv-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Latium, on the</hi> Via Appia, now <hi rend="ital">Cività Lavinia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">17, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 29</bibl>; cf. Mann. Ital. 1, p. 635.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25818.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lānŭvīnus (Lānĭv-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lanuvium, Lanuvian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lā-nŭvīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an estate at Lanuvium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lānŭvīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Lanuvium, Lanuvians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 14 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
lanx: <entryFree id="n25819" type="main" key="lanx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lanx</orth>, <itype>lancis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">le/kos, leka/nh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n25819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plate, platter, charger, dish</hi> (class.; cf.: patina, patella, magis, scutula). </sense><sense id="n25819.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">in lancibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in filicatis lancibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomum de caelata sumere lance,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:5:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cumulantque oneratis lancibus aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter lances mensasque nitentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotundae lances,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui furtum quaerere velit, nudus quaerat, linteo cinctus, lancem habens, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:192" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 192</bibl></cit> sqq.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=116" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 116</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:18:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:10:8" default="NO">16, 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic implet leves scutulas, cavasque lances,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:32:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 32, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">squilla distendat pectore lancem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:80" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25819.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the scale</hi> of a balance (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">libra, statera, trutina): necesse est lancem in libra ponderibus impositis deprimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 12, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Critolaus cum in alteram lancem animi bona imponat, in alteram corporis et externa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 51</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 91</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter ipse duas aequato examine lances Sustinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:725" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 725</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in altera lance Claudius et Nero starent, in altera, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25819.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: vitam aequa lance pensitare, <hi rend="ital">to weigh</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consider impartially</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 7, 5, § 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequa lance examinare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 41, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paripendere lance cunctos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequa lance servari,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in like manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 20</bibl></cit>. <cb n="LAPI" /></sense></entryFree>
laocoon: <entryFree id="n25820" type="main" key="La_o^co^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏcŏon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Laucŏon</orth>), <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*laoko/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n25820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Priam and Hecaba, priest of the Thymbrean Apollo, who was killed, with his two sons, at the altar by two serpents</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 135" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicut in Laocoonte,</quote> <trans><tr>in the statue of Laocoon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 37</bibl></cit>.—Form Laucoön, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laodamia: <entryFree id="n25821" type="main" key="La_o^da^mi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏdămīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*laoda/meia</foreign>, <sense id="n25821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Acastus; she followed her husband Protesilāus, who had been slain by Hector, to the Lower World</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 243" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 243</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:110" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laodice: <entryFree id="n25822" type="main" key="La_o^di^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏdĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*laodi/kh</foreign>. <sense id="n25822.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Priam, who married Helicāon, son of the Thracian king, Antenor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 80" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 80</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25822.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A woman</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 135</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25822.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Antiochus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:14:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 14, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
laodicea: <entryFree id="n25823" type="main" key="La_o^di^ce_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏdĭcēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*laodi/keia</foreign>, <sense id="n25823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25823.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Cœle-Syria, near Lebanon</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Jusy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25823.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Phrygia Major</hi>, also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏdĭcīa</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Laudĭcēa</orth>, now <hi rend="ital">Eski Hissar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:1:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 1, 11 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25823.3" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25823.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏdĭcensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Laodicea, Laodicean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5</bibl></cit>. 20, 2; 13, 67, 1.—</sense><sense id="n25823.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏdĭcēni</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lau-dĭcēni</orth>, Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 4</bibl>, v. h. l.), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Laodicea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 23, 19, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laomedon: <entryFree id="n25824" type="main" key="La_o^me^don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏmĕdon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*laome/dwn</foreign>, <sense id="n25824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Priam and Ganymede, king of Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 14</bibl> (3, 6), 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:729" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 729</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 89" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 89</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25824.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏmĕdontēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*laomedo/nteios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Laomedon</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 542</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Vestal fire brought by Æneas to Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:543" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 543</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25824.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏmĕdontĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Laomedon</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Æneas</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pubes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Trojan youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25824.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏmĕ-dontĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Laomedon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Priamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:326" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 326</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāŏmĕdontĭădae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Trojans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 248</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lapathium: <entryFree id="n25825" type="main" key="la^pa^thi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpăthĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. lapathum.</entryFree>
lapathum: <entryFree id="n25826" type="greek" key="la^pa^thum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpăthum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpăthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen>, Lucil.; <sense id="n25826.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>. Ante-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpăthĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 550, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 103</bibl> Müll.), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/paqon</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">la/paqos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">sorrel.</hi>—Form lapathum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 85, § 231</bibl>.—Form lapathus, Col. poët. 10, 373.—In <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:8:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 8, 24</bibl>.—In a dub. form: <cit><quote lang="la">lapathi brevis herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 2, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lapathus: <entryFree id="n25827" type="main" key="La^pa^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăpăthüs</orth>, <itype>untis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fort</hi> or <hi rend="ital">castle in Thessaly, at Tempe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6" default="NO" valid="yes">6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lapicida: <entryFree id="n25828" type="main" key="la^pi^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭcīda</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdĭcīda</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lapiscaedo</etym>, <sense id="n25828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a quarryman, stone-cutter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui lapides caedunt, lapicidas dici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=62" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 62</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidicida,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapicidinae: <entryFree id="n25829" type="main" key="la^pi^ci_di_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭcīdīnae</orth> (‡ <sense id="n25829.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">LAPICAEDINAE,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1243</bibl></cit>.—Collat. form lapidicinae; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">stone-quarries</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in lapicidinas facite deductus siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Chiorum lapidicinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 7, 11, § 55</bibl>: lapidicinae ubi exciduntur lapides, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 34, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lapicidinarius: <entryFree id="n25830" type="gloss" key="la^pi^ci_di_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭcīdīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a superintendent of stone-quarries</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3246</bibl>; cf.: ‡lapicidinarius, <foreign lang="greek">laceuth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox. —Collat. form: ‡lapidicinarius, <foreign lang="greek">liqoco/os</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lapicini: <entryFree id="n25831" type="main" key="Lapici_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lapicīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Liguria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lapidaris: <entryFree id="n25832" type="gloss" key="la^pi^da_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lapis</etym>, <sense id="n25832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of stone, stone-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">TERMINI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4334</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapidarius: <entryFree id="n25833" type="main" key="la^pi^da_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to stones, stone-</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">latomiae,</quote> <trans><tr>stone-quarries</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <trans><tr>that carries stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidariae litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>cut in stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">‡OPIFICES,</quote> <trans><tr>stone-cutters</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4208</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a stonecutter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:5:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 5, § 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4220</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 45, 13</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n25833.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Full of stones, stony</hi>, for lapidosus: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapidat: <entryFree id="n25834" type="main" key="la^pi^dat"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdat</orth>, v. lapido. <pb n="1035" /> <cb n="LAPI" /></entryFree>
lapidatio: <entryFree id="n25835" type="main" key="la^pi^da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lapido</etym>, <sense id="n25835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing of stones, a stoning</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n25835.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit magna lapidatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 197</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 73" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 73</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidationes persaepe vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:36:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 36, 77</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25835.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A shower of stones</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">non diu lapidatione terruere Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:9:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hail-storm</hi>: grandinis lapidatio, Imp. Constant. Cod. 9, 18, 4.</sense></entryFree>
lapidator: <entryFree id="n25836" type="hapax" key="la^pi^da_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stoner, thrower of stones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">percussor, lapidator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 5, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapidesco: <entryFree id="n25837" type="main" key="la^pi^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n25837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [lapis], <hi rend="ital">to become stone, turn to stone, to petrify</hi> (Plinian): <cit><quote lang="la">spongiae ipsae lapidescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 73, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in balano lapidescit duritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:22" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 2, 11, § 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lapideus: <entryFree id="n25838" type="main" key="la^pi^de^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n25838.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of stone, consisting of stones, stone-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25838.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">flumen marginibus lapideis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:18:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 18, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imber,</quote> <trans><tr>a shower of stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:28:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 28, 60</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pluit lapideo imbri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 38, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lapideo mortario terere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 11, 74, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:7:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25838.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (ante-class.): lapideo sunt corde multi, quos non miseret neminis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=162" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 162</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 174 Vahl.): lapideus sum, <hi rend="ital">I am petrified</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commovere me miser non audeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25838.3" n="II" level="1"> For lapidosus, <hi rend="ital">full of stones, stony</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">lapidei campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:57" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 10, 31, § 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapidicaesor: <entryFree id="n25839" type="gloss" key="la^pi^di^caesor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdĭcaesor</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">lato/mos</foreign>, <sense id="n25839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stone-cutter</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lapidicida: <entryFree id="n25840" type="main" key="la^pi^di^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdĭcīda</orth>, v. lapicida.</entryFree>
lapidicinae: <entryFree id="n25841" type="main" key="la^pi^di^ci_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdĭcīnae</orth>, v. lapicidinae.</entryFree>
lapido: <entryFree id="n25842" type="main" key="la^pi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lapis</etym>, <sense id="n25842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw stones at</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to stone</hi> ( = lapidibus obruo, percutio; not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n25842.1" n="I" level="1"> With personal object: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus imperatorem lapidavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum lapidare coeperunt, Auct. B. Hisp. 23: Stephanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Paulum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25842.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To cast stones upon, to bury</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeteriens aliquis nos lapidabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 114, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25842.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With an inanim. object: <cit><quote lang="la">quo defunctus est die, lapidata sunt templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25842.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to assail, assault, strike at</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">notantes impotentiam ejus hac dicacitate lapidatam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n25842.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: lapidat, <hi rend="ital">it rains stones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia Veiis de caelo lapidaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Reate imbri lapidavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 13</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> form: <cit><quote lang="la">quod de caelo lapidatum esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter crebrius eo anno de caelo lapidatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapidositas: <entryFree id="n25843" type="main" key="la^pi^do_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lapidosus</etym>, <sense id="n25843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stony hardness</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Hab. Mul. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lapidosus: <entryFree id="n25844" type="main" key="la^pi^do_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭdōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lapis</etym>, <sense id="n25844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of stones, stony</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25844.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidosa terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:799" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 799</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluvius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25844.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hard as stone, stony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus pirorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chiragra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 58</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est lapidosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 30, § 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapillisco: <entryFree id="n25845" type="hapax" key="la^pillisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpillisco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lăpillesco</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n25845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [lapillus], <hi rend="ital">to become stone, turn to stone;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">to become hard, be distended</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lapillulus: <entryFree id="n25846" type="main" key="la^pillu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpillŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very little stone, gravel-stone</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 10, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lapillus: <entryFree id="n25847" type="main" key="la^pillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>lapis</etym>, <sense id="n25847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little stone, a pebble</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n25847.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">invitat somnos crepitantibus unda lapillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 604</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:59 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 30, § 59 sq.</bibl> —Lucky days were marked with white, and unlucky ones with black stones (cf. calculus, 2. e.); <cit><quote lang="la">hence: felix utraque lux diesque nobis Signandi melioribus lapillis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with white stones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:53:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 53, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc Macrine, diem numera meliore lapillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 40, 41, § 131</bibl>. —In trials at law, a white stone was cast as a vote for acquittal, a black stone for condemnation: <cit><quote lang="la">mos erat antiquus niveis atrisque lapillis, His damnare reos, illis absolvere culpa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25847.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25847.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Stone in the bladder, gravel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejectus calculoso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 9, § 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25847.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone, gem, jewel; marble</hi>, etc.: inter niveos viridesque lapillos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">pearls and</hi> <cb n="LAPI" /> <hi rend="ital">emeralds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caris aures onerare lapillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:110:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 110, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libyci,</quote> <trans><tr>bits of Numidian marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25847.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tombstone</hi>, Inscr. ap. Murat. 1536, 6; cf. Burm. Anth. Lat. 2, p. 269.</sense></entryFree>
lapio: <entryFree id="n25848" type="main" key="la^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lapis</etym>, <sense id="n25848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn into stone, make hard like stone, to petrify, harden</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">lapit significat obdurefacit et lapidem facit. Pacuvius Periboea: lapit cor cura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 23, 7 sq.</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Fragm. Trag. v. 276" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Fragm. Trag. v. 276</bibl> Rib.): lapit dolore afficit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=118" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 118</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lapis: <entryFree id="n25849" type="main" key="la^pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> lapi, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 708</bibl> P.; <sense id="n25849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> lapiderum, C. Gell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 40</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen>: tanto sublatae sunt augmine tunc lapides, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 211, 9</bibl>) [etym. dub.; perh. from same root with rupes; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 545; not connected with <foreign lang="greek">la=as</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 542" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 542</bibl>], <hi rend="ital">a stone</hi> (cf.: saxum, silex, cautes, cos, calculus). </sense><sense id="n25849.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">stillicidi casus lapidem cavat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undique lapides in murum jaci coepti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 15, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars eminus glande aut lapidibus pugnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 57, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapide percussus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem habere, ut illi cerebrum excutiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 197</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul ingentem vim modicorum, qui funda mitti possent, lapidum paraverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:14:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 14, 3</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">e lapide duro parietes construere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 51, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis duritia marmoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 46, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibulus,</quote> <trans><tr>sandstone, pumice-stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 348</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molaris,</quote> <trans><tr>a millstone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:19:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 19, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">num me illue ducis, ubi lapis lapidem terit?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>into the mill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: Parius, <hi rend="ital">Parian stone</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Parian marble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:593" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 593</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapide candidiore diem notare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to mark with a white stone the luckiest day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 148</bibl></cit>; cf. lapillus.—</sense><sense id="n25849.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> for dulness, stupidity, want of feeling: <cit><quote lang="la">ego me credidi homini docto rem mandare: is lapidi mando maximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i, quid stas, lapis? quin accipis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, inquam, mulier, quae me omnino lapidem, non hominem putas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with silex (q. v.): tu es lapide silice stultior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 78</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides mehercule omnes flere ac lamentari coëgisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis est ferrumque suam quicumque puellam verberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:59" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut mare prospiciens in saxo frigida sedi, quamque lapis sedes, tam lapis ipsa fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 30</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem ferre altera manu, altera panem ostentare,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to flatter openly and injure secretly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verberare lapidem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to hurt one's self more than one's enemy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak hard words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eundem lapidem bis offendere,</quote> <trans><tr>to commit the same error twice</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bis ad eundem (sc. lapidem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25849.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25849.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mile-stone</hi>, set up on the roads at every thousand paces, which made a Roman mile; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, with an ordinal numeral added to denote distance in miles: ad quartum et vicesimum lapidem a Roma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effoditur ad vigesimum ab Urbe lapidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 56, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra videt fieri sextus ab Urbe lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:682" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 682</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra vicesimum lapidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodecimum apud lapidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tertio lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: ad lapidem undecimum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl> Müll.—Sometimes ellipt. without lapis: <cit><quote lang="la">ad duodecimum a Cremona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quartum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad octavum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25849.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The stone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stone elevation on which the prætor stood at slavesales</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eo ipso astas lapide, ubi praeco praedicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter duos de lapide emptos tribunos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 15, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25849.6" n="C" level="2"> Terminalis, <hi rend="ital">a landmark, boundary-stone</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called lapis alone,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lapis sacer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non fixus in agris, qui regeret certis finibus arva, lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25849.7" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A gravestone, tombstone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 1, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 54</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also ultimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25849.8" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone, gem, jewel, pearl</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 69, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmas et lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clari lapides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:231" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:50:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 50, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25849.9" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A statue</hi>: Jovem<cb n="LAPS" />  lapidem jurare, <hi rend="ital">the statue of Jupiter at the Capitol</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:21:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 21, 4</bibl>; v. Juppiter.—*</sense><sense id="n25849.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">albus,</quote> <trans><tr>a table of white marble, a marble table</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapitha: <entryFree id="n25850" type="main" key="La^pi^tha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăpĭtha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>com.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăpĭthes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Lapitha; plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăpĭthae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lapi/qai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Lapithæ</hi>, a rude tribe of mountaineers in Thessaly, about Olympus, who fought with the Centaurs at the wedding of Pirithŏüs, king of the Lapithæ, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 261</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">536</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 22</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lapithūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 304</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lapithae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 250</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> adjectively: <cit><quote lang="la">Lapithae genus heroinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit> (Müll. heroine); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lapithes eques,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:516" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 516</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25850.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25850.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăpĭthaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Lapithæ, Lapithean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:530" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 530</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25850.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăpĭthēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of the Lapithæ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:670" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 670</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25850.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăpĭ-thōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of the Lapithæ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:297" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 297</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lappa: <entryFree id="n25851" type="main" key="lappa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lappa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:104 al" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 17, 64, § 104 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n25851.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lappa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> e. g. Rubrenus Lappa, <hi rend="ital">a tragedian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lappaceus: <entryFree id="n25852" type="hapax" key="lappa_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lappācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lappa</etym>, <sense id="n25852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">burshaped, bur-like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 19, § 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lappago: <entryFree id="n25853" type="main" key="lappa_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lappāgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant resembling a bur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 65, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laprius: <entryFree id="n25854" type="main" key="Lapri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Laprĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Jupiter</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22, 23</bibl> (<bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> p. 173</bibl> Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
lapsana: <entryFree id="n25855" type="greek" key="lapsa^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lapsăna</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lampsăna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">lapsănium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Hier. ap. Reg. S. Pachom. 52), = <foreign lang="greek">laya/nh</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">lamya/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n25855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an edible plant, charlock</hi>, Sinapis arvensis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 37, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 25</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsanā vivere,</quote> <trans><tr>to live on a meagre diet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 144</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapsilis: <entryFree id="n25856" type="gloss" key="lapsi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lapsĭlis</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">gli/sxros</foreign>, <sense id="n25856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slippery</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lapsio: <entryFree id="n25857" type="hapax" key="lapsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lapsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. labor</etym>, <sense id="n25857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sliding;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">an inclination, tendency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec in bonis rebus facilitas nominetur, in malis proclivitas, ut significet lapsionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapso: <entryFree id="n25858" type="main" key="lapso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lapso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n25858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to slip, slide, stumble, fall</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25858.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">(Priamum) in multo lapsantem sanguine nati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 551</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine suo et lubrico paludum lapsantes (equi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsantibus equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsantem gressum firmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:632" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 632</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:10:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gyan vidi lapsare cruentae Vulnere Myrmidonis,</quote> <trans><tr>fall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:223" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantis lapsantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25858.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">verba lapsantia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>babbled forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 15, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lapsus: <entryFree id="n25859" type="main" key="lapsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lapsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. labor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25860" type="main" key="lapsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lapsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. labor</etym>, <sense id="n25860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling, fall; a slipping, sliding, gliding, running, flowing, flying, flight</hi>, etc. (class.). </sense><sense id="n25860.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac celeri ferme percurrunt fulmina lapsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ea, quae lapsu tandem cecidere vetusto, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 11, 19: infrenis equi lapsu jacens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:750" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 750</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum quassao nutant turres, lapsumque minantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrere lapsus tectorum assiduos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—Of a landslide: <cit><quote lang="la">locus recenti lapsu terrae abruptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapsu scalarum exanimatus,</quote> <trans><tr>by falling down stairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 37, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque sustinere se a lapsu possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerilium dentium,</quote> <trans><tr>the shedding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:6:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si lacus emissus lapsu et cursu suo ad mare profluxisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(stellae) certo lapsu spatioque feruntur,</quote> <trans><tr>course</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">medio volvuntur sidera lapsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molli zephyros descendere lapsu adspiciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:686" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepere deae, celerique per aethera lapsu, periere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucrum lapsus,</quote> <trans><tr>flight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>; cf.: facili lapsu ad deos pervolare, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 18</bibl> (19), 6: <cit><quote lang="la">gemini lapsu delubra ad summa dracones Effugiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis serpens multiplici lapsu et erratico,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotarum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rolling wheels</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A, 2, 236</bibl></cit> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">troxw=n ba/seis</foreign>, Soph. Elect. 718; <cit><quote lang="la">and remigium alarum = alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 301</bibl></cit>): arte materna rapidos morantem Fluminum<pb n="1036" /> <cb n="LAQU" />  lapsus, i. e. flumina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n25860.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of the effects of a fall; in <number>plur.</number>: contra ulcera, rupta, lapsusque, <hi rend="ital">bruises, contusions</hi> received in falling, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 17, 20, § 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25860.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a failing, error, fault</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">amor lapsum animi ludificat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni lapsu continere temeritatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to restrain one's rashness in believing from leading him into error</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sint populares multi variique lapsus,</quote> <trans><tr>of losing popularity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:83:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 83, 339</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud alius fidei pronior lapsus, quam ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 1, 1, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laquear: <entryFree id="n25861" type="main" key="la^que^ar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕāre</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 62</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 691</bibl> P.; and: laqueare, <foreign lang="greek">suni/qwma</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 12</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindr. with laqueus and lacunar</etym>, <sense id="n25861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a panelled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fretted ceiling</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; usu. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">laquearia, quae nunc et in privatis domibus auro teguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 18, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetior quam laquearium auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dependent lychni laquearibus aureis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laquearia tecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:142" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelata laquearia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:42" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:90:15" default="NO">90, 15</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sub laqueare domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laquearium: <entryFree id="n25862" type="main" key="la^que^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. laquear <sense id="n25862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
laquearius: <entryFree id="n25863" type="main" key="la^que^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>laquear</etym>, <sense id="n25863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that makes panelled ceilings, a ceiling-maker</hi> (late Lat.): architecti, laquearii, Cod. Th. 13, 4, 2.—</sense><sense id="n25863.1" n="II" level="1"> Perh. <hi rend="ital">a kind of gladiator;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
laqueator: <entryFree id="n25864" type="main" key="la^que^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>laqueus</etym>, <sense id="n25864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ensnarer</hi>, a kind of gladiator who attempted to catch his adversary with a noose, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 56</bibl> (al. laquearius).</sense></entryFree>
laqueatus: <entryFree id="n25865" type="main" key="la^que^a_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. 1. laqueo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n25866" type="main" key="la^que^a_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. 2. laqueo.</entryFree>
laqueo: <entryFree id="n25867" type="main" key="la^que^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laqueus</etym>, <sense id="n25867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to noose, ensnare, entangle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n25867.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">extentis laqueare profundum Retibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cassem Per senos circum usque sinus laqueabis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to plait</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus laqueatum et distentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueatis resistentium membris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueatis cruribus (elephantorum),</quote> <trans><tr>entangled</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25867.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to ensnare</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">si te forte oculi dextri laqueaverit error,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 537</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25868" type="main" key="la^que^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕo</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lăcŭo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>laquear</etym>, <sense id="n25868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to adorn with a panelled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fretted ceiling</hi> (perh. only in the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi>): tectis caelatis lacuatis, <hi rend="ital">panelled, fretted</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:35:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 35, 85</bibl> (Trag. v. 121 Vahl.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 726</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovis Capitolini templum, non laqueatum auro tantum, sed parietibus totis lammina inauratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">considerat templum, videt undique tectum pulcherrime laqueatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:51:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 51, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueata tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenationes laqueatae,</quote> <trans><tr>panelled dining - rooms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laqueus: <entryFree id="n25869" type="main" key="la^que^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăquĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(/lkw</foreign>, draw, <foreign lang="greek">o(lko/s</foreign>; Lat. lacio; perh. Germ. locken</etym>, <sense id="n25869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a noose, snare</hi> (class.; cf. tendicula). </sense><sense id="n25869.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa laqueis vinciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueis falces avertebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum in laqueum inserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:17:section=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>: inicere laqueum, <hi rend="ital">to throw over</hi> any one, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inicere cervicibus laqueum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueo gulam alicui frangere,</quote> <trans><tr>to throttle, strangle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad laqueum compellere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to the halter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui mandare laqueum,</quote> <trans><tr>to bid go and be hanged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque carcer neque laqueus,</quote> <trans><tr>a halter, gallows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">faucesque jam exanimis laqueo vexatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 40</bibl></cit>.—Of a snare, trap or lasso used by hunters: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueis captare feras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metuit foveam lupus accipiterque Suspectos laqueos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laqueos et muscipula effugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">impliciti laqueis nudus uterque jacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 580</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare in laqueum vestigia,</quote> <trans><tr>to step into a snare</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:244" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 244</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25869.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a snare, gin, trap</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25869.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">judicii laqueos declinans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 15, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogationum laqueis aliquem irretire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laquei Stoicorum,</quote> <trans><tr>subtleties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chrysippi laquei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum et condicionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:55:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 55, 150</bibl></cit>: verbi laqueo capere, id. <cb n="LARE" /> Caecin. 29, 83.—Without a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hos inexplicabiles laqueos inciderunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:101" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(testes) inducuntur in laqueos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sciens in hoc se laqueos induxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 12, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25869.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fetters, chains, hinderances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi fortuna laqueum impegit, quem nec solvere posses nec erumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunquamne hos artissimos laqueos abrumpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lar: <entryFree id="n25870" type="main" key="La_r1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lār</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lars</orth>, <itype>Lartis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25870.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prænomen of Etruscan origin</hi> (in Etruscan, usu: <cit><quote lang="la">the prefix of the first-born, while a younger son was called Aruns. The name Lar, Lars, or Larth was an honorary appellation in Etruscan, = Engl. lord): Lars Tolumnius, rex Veientium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 58, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Lartem Porsenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 9</bibl></cit> (<case>nom.</case> Lar, <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 110</bibl> P.).</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n25871" type="main" key="La_r2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lār</orth>, <itype>Lăris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. 1. Lares, ium.</entryFree>
lara: <entryFree id="n25872" type="main" key="La^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lărunda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of the river-god Almo, a nymph whose tongue was cut out by Jupiter on account of her talkativeness, and who was worshipped in Rome under the name of</hi> Tacita <hi rend="ital">or</hi> Muta: <cit><quote lang="la">Lara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:599 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 599 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Larunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=74" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 74</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 35</bibl>; Aus. Idyll. ap. Monos. de Deis, 9.</sense></entryFree>
laralia: <entryFree id="n25873" type="gloss" key="La^ra_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lărālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. Lares</etym>, <sense id="n25873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a festival in honor of the Lares</hi>, celebrated on the first of May; <hi rend="ital">the festival of the Lares</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=253" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 253</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lararium: <entryFree id="n25874" type="main" key="la^ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lărārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part of the interior of a Roman house, in which the tutelar deities</hi> (Lares) <hi rend="ital">were placed, the chapel of the Lares</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 29, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 4</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
larbason: <entryFree id="n25875" type="hapax" key="larba^son"><orth extent="full" lang="la">larbăson</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">antimony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 33, § 101</bibl> (Sillig, larbasim).</sense></entryFree>
larcius: <entryFree id="n25876" type="main" key="Larci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Larcĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <sense id="n25876.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">T. Larcius Flavus,</quote> <trans><tr>a Roman dictator</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lardarius: <entryFree id="n25877" type="gloss" key="larda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lardārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lardum for laridum</etym>, <sense id="n25877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pork-butcher, pork-seller</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 647, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lardum: <entryFree id="n25878" type="main" key="lardum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lardum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. laridum.</entryFree>
larentia: <entryFree id="n25879" type="main" key="La_renti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lārentĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lārentīna</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (also called Acca Larentia), acc. to the myth, <sense id="n25879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of Faustulus, and mother of the twelve Arval Brothers, who suckled and reared the twins Romulus and Remus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:55" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L.
