L. 6, § 23</bibl> Müll.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lārentā-lia</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival celebrated in honor of Larentia, on the 23d of December</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 57</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=119" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 119</bibl> Müll.—Also in a lengthened form: ‡<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lārentīnal</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:3:58:section=23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 3, 58, § 23</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lares: <entryFree id="n25880" type="main" key="La^res1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăres</orth> (old form ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăses</orth>, Inscr. Fratr. Arval.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 2</bibl> Müll.), um and ĭum (Larum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=49" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 49</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 961</bibl>: <sense id="n25880.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Larium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 52</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>old Lat. Lases; Etrusc. Laran, Lalan; root las-; cf. lascivus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">tutelar deities, Lares</hi>, belonging orig. to the Etruscan religion, and worshipped especially as the presiders over and protectors of a particular locality (cf. Otfr. Müll. Etrusc. 2, p. 90 sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">praestites,</quote> <trans><tr>the tutelar deities of an entire city</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:129 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 129 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille Lares geniumque ducis, qui tradidit illos, urbs habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Puteolanae civitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatum, Inscr. ap. Grut. p. 10, 2: vicorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rurales, Inscr. ap. Grut. p. 251: compitales,</quote> <trans><tr>of cross - roads</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>; called also Lares compitalicii, Philarg. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 381</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viales,</quote> <trans><tr>worshipped by the road-side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permarini,</quote> <trans><tr>tutelar deities of the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 52</bibl></cit>: caelipotentes, Inscr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Spect. 5</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lari viali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1762</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1894</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eundem esse Genium et Larem, multi veteres memoriae prodiderunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25880.1" n="II" level="1"> Most commonly the Lares (as familiares or domestici), <hi rend="ital">the tutelar deities of a house, household gods, domestic Lares</hi> (whose images stood on the hearth in a little shrine, aedes, or in a small chapel, lararium); as the tutelar deities of each particular dwelling, also in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lar</orth>, <itype>Laris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n25880.2" n="(a)" level="5"> In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem divinam facere Laribus familiaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanctis Penatium deorum Larumque familiarium sedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aedem Larum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immolet aequis porcum Laribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laribus tuum Miscet numen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 5, 34</bibl></cit>. <cb n="LARG" /> —</sense><sense id="n25880.3" n="(b)" level="5"> In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego Lar sum familiaris, ex hac familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec imponuntur in foco nostro dari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae Lar pater, alium Larem persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n25880.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hearth, dwelling, home</hi> (class.; usually in <number>sing.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">larem corona nostrum decorari volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquent larem familiarem suum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad suum larem familiarem redire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 54</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">125: nobis larem familiarem nusquam ullum esse?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paternus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 56</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">avitus apto Cum lare fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 12, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudens lare certo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo sub lare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 29, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:82:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 82, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserere larem,</quote> <trans><tr>to abandon one's home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:478" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 478</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelli lare,</quote> <trans><tr>to be driven from a place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:362" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alumnus laris Antenorei,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the city of Padua</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:77:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 77, 2</bibl></cit>: ob eam rem tibi Lare commercioque interdico, Vet. Formul. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 4, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25880.5" n="(b)" level="5"> In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 302</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussa pars mutare lares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:39" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 39</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a bird's <hi rend="ital">nest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis in ramo tecta laremque parat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:242" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rapit Halcyones miserae fetumque laremque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:45" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25881" type="main" key="La^res2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăres</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 90</bibl> Kritz <hi rend="ital">N. cr</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
larga: <entryFree id="n25882" type="main" key="Larga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Larga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman of bad repute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
large: <entryFree id="n25883" type="main" key="large_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. largus <sense id="n25883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
largianus: <entryFree id="n25884" type="main" key="Largi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Largĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Largus.</entryFree>
largificus: <entryFree id="n25885" type="main" key="largi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>largus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n25885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bountiful</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 627</bibl>: grando mixta imbri largifico, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:39:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 39, 157</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 414 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
largifluus: <entryFree id="n25886" type="main" key="largi^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>large-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n25886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing copiously, copious</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 598</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
largiloquus: <entryFree id="n25887" type="main" key="largi^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>large-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n25887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talking copiously, talkative</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">largiloquae sumus: plus loquimur, quam sat est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
largimentum: <entryFree id="n25888" type="hapax" key="largi_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>largior</etym>, for largitas, <sense id="n25888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bounty, gift</hi>, Fulg. Myth. praef. 1.</sense></entryFree>
largio: <entryFree id="n25889" type="main" key="largi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭo</orth>, <itype>4</itype>, v. largior <sense id="n25889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
largior: <entryFree id="n25890" type="main" key="largi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; collat. form of the <sense id="n25890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> largibar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 25</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> largibere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 30</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> largirier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 82</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form, v. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>1. largus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to give bountifully, to lavish, bestow, dispense, distribute, impart</hi> (class.; cf.: dono, suppedito). </sense><sense id="n25890.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25890.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">amico homini mea ex crumena largiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex ea (dote) largiri te illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cenam esurientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 155</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eripiunt aliis, quod aliis largiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 14, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alieno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros emeritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitur in servos quantum aderat pecuniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile largiri de alieno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">sol universis idem lucis largitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: Gallis provinciae propinquitas multa ad copiam atque usus largitur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25890.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to give largesses, to bribe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">largiundo et pollicitando magis incendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum largiendo corrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largiendo de alieno popularem fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>: dictis largiri, <hi rend="ital">to bestow in words</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to promise</hi> without power to give: <cit><quote lang="la">quid nunc acturu's, postquam erili filio largitu's dictis dapsilis lubentias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25890.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to confer, bestow, grant, yield</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hortensio summam copiam facultatemque dicendi natura largita est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrisque fortuna regnum est largita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium parcus in largienda civitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plusculum amori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occasionem clamandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid solamen humandi est, largior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 494</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">alicui occasionem impudentiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Istoscine patrem aequom morest liberis largirier?</quote> <trans><tr>to teach, communicate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id largiamur inertiae nostrae,</quote> <trans><tr>give up, concede</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 68</bibl></cit>: reipublicae injurias. <hi rend="ital">to forgive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia in vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totus habenas,</quote> <trans><tr>to give, re lax</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:724" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 724</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: se largiri, <hi rend="ital">to bestow one's society, to be free</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eager</hi> in courtship: nam tu te vilem feceris, si te ultro largiere: sine ultro veniat, quaeritet, etc., <pb n="1037" /> <cb n="LARG" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25890.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With foll. <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis mihi deus largiatur, ut ex hac aetate repuerascam,</quote> <trans><tr>would grant</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 23, 83</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n25890.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭo</orth>, īre; <hi rend="ital">act. imp.</hi> largi, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 26</bibl>; so, Lucil. ib. —* </sense><sense id="n25890.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">largītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:129" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
largitas: <entryFree id="n25891" type="main" key="largi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. largus</etym>, <sense id="n25891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abundance, bounty, liberality</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">largitas nimia, opp. parsimonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae istaec subita est largitas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui muneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra fruges cum maxima largitate fundit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 156</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
largiter: <entryFree id="n25892" type="main" key="largi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. largus <sense id="n25892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
largitio: <entryFree id="n25893" type="main" key="largi_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>largior</etym>, <sense id="n25893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giving freely, a granting, bestowing, dispensing, distributing, imparting</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25893.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25893.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">largitio, quae fit ex re familiari, fontem ipsum benignitatis exhaurit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitione redemit militum voluntates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his pauca ad spem largitionis addidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximas largitiones fecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitio et communicatio civitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>a granting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequitatis,</quote> <trans><tr>a distributing, dispensing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 20, 41</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">largitio fundum non habet,</quote> <trans><tr>there is no end of giving</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 55</bibl></cit>; v. fundus.—</sense><sense id="n25893.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in a bad sense. </sense><sense id="n25893.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bribery, corruption</hi>, esp. to obtain a public office: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitatem ac benignitatem ab ambitu atque largitione sejungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribum turpi largitione corrumpere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus largitione devinctas habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 37, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profusissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum largitionis genus omisit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n25893.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Profusion, prodigality</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius rei, minime beneficiorum, honesta largitio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25893.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, concr., largitiones, <hi rend="ital">the imperial treasury, public chest</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">imperial fund</hi> for presents and distributions, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 62, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">both sacrae (for public or state purposes) and privatae (for personal outlay),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 23, 2</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 12, 6, 13.</sense></entryFree>
largitionalis: <entryFree id="n25894" type="main" key="largi_ti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largītĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>largitio, II.</etym>, <sense id="n25894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the imperial treasury</hi>: officiales, <hi rend="ital">treasury-officers, masters of the treasury</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 6, 13; also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">largī-tĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a treasury-officer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
largitor: <entryFree id="n25895" type="spur" key="largi_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largītor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, false read. for largiri te, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 14</bibl>; v. Ritschl ad h. l. and proleg. p. 68.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25896" type="main" key="largi_tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>largior</etym>, <sense id="n25896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a liberal giver, a bestower, granter, dispenser, distributer, imparter</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25896.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): multarum rerum ac maxume pecuniae largitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitor voluntarius repente senatus factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minime largitore duce,</quote> <trans><tr>liberal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">praedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacche, sacri largitor laticis,</quote> <trans><tr>dispenser</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:164" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25896.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">a briber</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exsistunt in re publica plerumque largitores et factiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujuscumque tribus largitor esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulum largitorem et prodigum non putat,</quote> <trans><tr>a spendthrift, squanderer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
largitudo: <entryFree id="n25897" type="main" key="largi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. largus</etym>, <sense id="n25897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">liberality</hi> (for largitas): <cit><quote lang="la">largitudo nusquam invenitur, nisi apud Nepotem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 78</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
largitus: <entryFree id="n25898" type="main" key="largi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭtus</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. largus <sense id="n25898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> C.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n25899" type="main" key="largi_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. largior.</entryFree>
largiusculus: <entryFree id="n25900" type="hapax" key="largi^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n25900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. largus], <hi rend="ital">rather copious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haustus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7, § 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
largus: <entryFree id="n25901" type="main" key="largus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">largus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. for lasgus; Sanscr. root lash, desire; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">la=</foreign>- in <foreign lang="greek">lilai/omai, lh=ma</foreign>; cf. Lat. lascivus</etym>, <sense id="n25901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abundant, copious, plentiful, large, much</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25901.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">pabula,</quote> <trans><tr>abundant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:869" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 869</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 412</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 1238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 282</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">undae fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1031" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 1031</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:806" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 806</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(sol) cum terras larga luce compleverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 758</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:894" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 894</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">largior ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largiore vino usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largiora stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potentem amicum Largiora flagito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus largissimum edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vena largissima ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 43, § 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25901.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen., abounding in</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">largus lacrumarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:338" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 338</bibl></cit>: fons <cb n="LARI" /> largus aquae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 608</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:601" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:250" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 250</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25901.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">audin' hunc, opera ut largus est nocturna?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia larga suco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25901.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">giving abundantly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">much, bountiful, profuse, liberal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">justus, injustus: malignus, largus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo sunt genera largorum, quorum alteri prodigi, alteri liberales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largissimus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:50:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 50, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largus et exundans ingenii fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:119" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largus animo,</quote> <trans><tr>of a generous disposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissis,</quote> <trans><tr>liberal in promises</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:301" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 301</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quid ego concesso pedibus, linguā largior?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">largus animae,</quote> <trans><tr>prodigal of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:603" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 603</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes donare novas largus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> in three forms. </sense><sense id="n25901.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">largē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>), <hi rend="ital">abundantly, plentifully, bountifully, liberally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">large blandus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">large dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">large effuseque donare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">large et copiose aliquid comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munifice et large dari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">large atque honorifice promittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 11:44" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">large liberaliterque aestimare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:88:section=204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 88, § 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministrare libertatem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consultum large factum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">large florescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 10, 31, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">large frequentantibus (locum),</quote> <trans><tr>in great numbers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 17, 15, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">large amplecti,</quote> <trans><tr>widely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 8, § 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:137" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 19, 30, § 137</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare largius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne potum largius aequo Rideat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 215</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia quam largissime facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:61:section=158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 61, § 158</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (Klotz, largissima), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 50, 51, § 167</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25901.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">largely, in abundance, plentifully, much; greatly, far</hi> (rare in class. prose; <cit><quote lang="la">not used by Cic.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccavisti largiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 49</bibl>: apud finitimas civitates largiter posse, <hi rend="ital">to have great weight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">influence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">distare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 622</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discrepare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largius a prisca consuetudine movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10, p. 583" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, p. 583</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25901.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Substantively, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (anteand post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">credo, illic inesse auri et argenti largiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 144</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">largiter mercedis indipiscar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 28</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n25901.8" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">largĭtus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">copiously</hi>: quid lacrimas largitus? Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 31</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 212 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25902" type="main" key="Largus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Largus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, esp. in the gens Scribonia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:59:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 59, 240</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Largus Caecina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 33</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25902.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Largĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Largus, Largian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
laridum: <entryFree id="n25903" type="main" key="la_ri^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lārĭdum</orth>, and sync. <orth extent="full" lang="la">lardum</orth> (collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lārĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, sc. caro, Cod. Th. 8, 4, 17), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">laro/s, larino/s</foreign>, fattened, fat</etym>, <sense id="n25903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fat of bacon, lard</hi>.—Form laridum: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta pernis pestis veniet! quanta labes larido!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 27</bibl>.—Form lardum: <cit><quote lang="la">lardum ossa fracta solidat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 16, 65, § 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:78" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:84" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 84</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">larda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:169" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 169</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
larifuga: <entryFree id="n25904" type="hapax" key="la^ri^fu^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lărĭfŭga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. lar-fugio</etym>, <sense id="n25904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vagabond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">larifuga nescio quis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
larignus: <entryFree id="n25905" type="hapax" key="la^rignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lărignus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>larix</etym>, <sense id="n25905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the larch-tree, larch-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
larinum: <entryFree id="n25906" type="main" key="La_ri_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lārīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Samnium, in the territory of the</hi> Frentani, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> Teanum, now <hi rend="ital">Larino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n25906.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lārī-nas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the town of Larinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Larinas socrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">municipium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lā-rīnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Larinum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in foro Larinatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
larinus: <entryFree id="n25907" type="main" key="la^ri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lărĭnus</orth>, v. lamyros.</entryFree>
larissa: <entryFree id="n25908" type="main" key="La_rissa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lārissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*la/rissa</foreign>, <sense id="n25908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several cities</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25908.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In Thessaly, on the Peneus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Yeni-shehr</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Larissa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 355</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25908.2" n="B" level="2"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n25908.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāris-saeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the town of Larissa, Larissean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achilles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Thessalian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 197</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also, hasta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Achilles</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 46, 836</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Coronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 542</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lārissaei</orth>,<cb n="LASC" />  <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Larissa, Larisseans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25908.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lāris-senses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Larissa, Larisseans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25908.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Phthiotis</hi>, also called Larissa Cremaste, near the modern <hi rend="ital">Gardhiki</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:56" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 56</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25908.6" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fortress of Argos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 25, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
larissus: <entryFree id="n25909" type="main" key="Larissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Larissus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Larīsus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Achaia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
larius: <entryFree id="n25910" type="main" key="La_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">on which</hi> Comum <hi rend="ital">lay</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago di Como</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 131</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Larius, Larian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Larium litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 35, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
larix: <entryFree id="n25911" type="greek" key="la^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lărix</orth>, ĭcis <gen>f.</gen> (<gen>m.</gen> Vitruv., <sense id="n25911.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), = <foreign lang="greek">la/ric</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a larch, larch-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:920" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 920</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laronia: <entryFree id="n25912" type="main" key="La^ro_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lărōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:65" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:32:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 32, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laros: <entryFree id="n25913" type="main" key="la^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. larus.</entryFree>
lars: <entryFree id="n25914" type="main" key="Lars"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lars</orth>, v. 1. Lar.</entryFree>
lartidius: <entryFree id="n25915" type="main" key="Lartidi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lartidĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, prop. name, <sense id="n25915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an imitator of Ulysses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
larunda: <entryFree id="n25916" type="main" key="La^runda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lărunda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Lara.</entryFree>
larus: <entryFree id="n25917" type="greek" key="la^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lărus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lăros</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n25917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ravenous sea-bird</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the mew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 14, 15</bibl>; cf.: larus, <foreign lang="greek">la/ros</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
larva: <entryFree id="n25918" type="main" key="larva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">larva</orth> (ante-class. as trisyl. <orth extent="full" lang="la">lārŭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. lar</etym>, <sense id="n25918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ghost, spectre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">larvae stimulant virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amator qui me et uxorem ludificatust larva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 15</bibl>: cum mortuis non nisi larvas luctari, Plin. praef. H. N. § 31.—As a term of reproach, <hi rend="ital">hobgoblin, scarecrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam loquere larŭa?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam haec quidem edepol larvarum plenast,</quote> <trans><tr>possessed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25918.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25918.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mask</hi> (cf. persona): <cit><quote lang="la">nil illi larva et tragicis opus esse cothurnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25918.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A skeleton</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
larvalis: <entryFree id="n25919" type="main" key="larva_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">larvālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">larŭālis</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>larva</etym>, <sense id="n25919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a ghost, ghostly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">habitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 25</bibl></cit>; so, si larvali habitu processeris, Lex ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 4</bibl>, b, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">macies larŭalis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 32, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
larvialis: <entryFree id="n25920" type="main" key="larvi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">larvĭālis</orth>, v. larvalis.</entryFree>
larvo: <entryFree id="n25921" type="main" key="larvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">larvo</orth>, no <sense id="n25921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum (<hi rend="ital">part.</hi> ante-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">larŭātus</orth>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>larva</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to bewitch, enchant</hi> (ante- and post-class., and used almost exclusively in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): artus larvari, Firm. Math. 3, 14.—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">larvans</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an enchanter, a dealer in magic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc denique qui larvam putat ipse est larvans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 315, 20</bibl></cit> Hildeb. (al. larvatus).—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">larŭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">bewitched, enchanted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid illi esse morbi dixeras? ... Num larvatust aut cerritus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: pro laruato te circumferam, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
larymna: <entryFree id="n25922" type="main" key="Larymna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Larymna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a small town in Bœotia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lasanum: <entryFree id="n25923" type="greek" key="la^sa^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăsănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/sanon</foreign>, <sense id="n25923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a utensil</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25923.1" n="I" level="1"> Perh. <hi rend="ital">a cooking-utensil, cooking-pot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25923.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A chamber utensil, closestool</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 41, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lasar: <entryFree id="n25924" type="main" key="la^sar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăsar</orth>, v. laser.</entryFree>
lasarpicifer: <entryFree id="n25925" type="main" key="la^sarpi_ci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăsarpīcĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lasarpicium for laserpicium-fero</etym>, <sense id="n25925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">producing assafœtida</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lascive: <entryFree id="n25926" type="main" key="lasci_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lascīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lascivus <sense id="n25926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>
lascivia: <entryFree id="n25927" type="main" key="lasci_vi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lascīvĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lascivus</etym>, <sense id="n25927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sportiveness, playfulness, frolicsomeness, jollity</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25927.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens plenus amoris ac lasciviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hilaritas et lascivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeta (agrestium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nudi juvenes, Lycaeum Pana venerantes, per lusum atque lasciviam currerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">in juvenales lusus lasciviamque versi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 16, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 20, 5</bibl>: piscium, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:14:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 14, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid per lasciviam, et non data opera ut furtum committeretur, factum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:181" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 181</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 123</bibl></cit>.—Comic.: <cit><quote lang="la">o virgarum lascivia,</quote> <trans><tr>thou scourge's pastime!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25927.2" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">wantonness, licentiousness, petulance, impudence, lewdness, lasciviousness</hi> (mostly postAug.; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): quos soluto imperio licentia corruperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with superbia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:76" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatralis populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 13</bibl></cit>: lasciviae<pb n="1038" /> <cb n="LASE" />  notae, <hi rend="ital">of lewdness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesonia luxuriae ac lasciviae perditae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25</bibl></cit>: ignoscitur, nisi in lata et incauta neglegentia vel lascivia fuit, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 12, 5, 2; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Gai. Inst. l. l. supra. —Of a licentious, prolix style: lasciviae flosculis capi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios recens haec lascivia deliciaeque et omnia ad voluptatem multitudinis imperitae composita delectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lasciviam a vobis prohibetote,</quote> <trans><tr>impious exultation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 10, 3</bibl></cit> Gronov. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
lascivibundus: <entryFree id="n25928" type="hapax" key="lasci_vi_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lascīvībundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lascivio</etym>, <sense id="n25928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wanton, full of petulance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 16</bibl> (Ritschl and Fleck. lixabundus, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
lascivio: <entryFree id="n25929" type="main" key="lasci_vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lascīvĭo</orth>, <itype>ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>lascivus</etym>, <sense id="n25929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be wanton, petulant, sportive, to sport, frisk, frolic</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n25929.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: licet lascivire, dum nihil metuas, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ap. Claudius ait, lascivire magis plebem quam saevire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentiam lasciviendi permittere militi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo principio lascivire miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsilit agnus Lascivitque fuga,</quote> <trans><tr>and wantonly frisks away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 321</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">angues ... lascivientium piscium modo exsultasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 5</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextera lascivit caesa Tegeatide capra (of the Luperci, who wantonly struck at passers-by),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:329" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferratus lascivit apex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis lascivit aquis et ab aethere ludit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>. —Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">in Venerem,</quote> <trans><tr>to be lascivious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25929.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to indulge in license</hi> of language or style (a favorite expression of Quintilian): <cit><quote lang="la">lascivimus syntonorum modis saltitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:142" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto et rerum et verborum et compositionis genere lasciviunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerilibus sententiolis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:6" default="NO">9, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ovidius lascivire in Metamorphosesi solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lascivitas: <entryFree id="n25930" type="main" key="lasci_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lascīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wantonness</hi> (post-class.): Asiana, Firm. 1, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lasciviter: <entryFree id="n25931" type="main" key="lasci_vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lascīvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lascivus <sense id="n25931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
lascivulus: <entryFree id="n25932" type="hapax" key="lasci_vu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lascīvŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n25932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [lascivus], <hi rend="ital">a little</hi> or <hi rend="ital">somewhat wanton</hi>: manus, Laev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 903</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
lascivus: <entryFree id="n25933" type="main" key="lasci_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lascīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. lash-āmi, desire; las-āmi, play; Gr. la- in <foreign lang="greek">la/w, lilai/omai</foreign>; cf. Goth. lustus; also Lat. largus</etym>, <sense id="n25933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wanton, petulant, sportive, playful, frolicsome, frisky</hi>, (syn.: petulans, procax). </sense><sense id="n25933.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense: nova proles, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 260</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currumque sequuntur matris lascivo sidera fulva choro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:88" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenero lascivior haedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:791" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 791</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hederae,</quote> <trans><tr>wanton, luxuriant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 36, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acus,</quote> <trans><tr>for ornamenting the hair, a hair-pin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:45:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 45, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Verg. Vel. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristia maestum Vultum verba decent. ... Ludentem lasciva,</quote> <trans><tr>sportive, playful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 107</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dicitur, aut est lascivum et hilare aut contumeliosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quod (caput aselli) lascivi ludebant ruris alumni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:98" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 98</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25933.2" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">licentious, lewd, lustful, lascivious</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14</bibl>: Siculi, ut sunt lascivi et dicaces, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <trans><tr>lascivious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <trans><tr>lewd</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellis ac sigillis lascivissimarum picturarum et figurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25933.3" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of style, <hi rend="ital">licentious, luxuriant, overloaded with ornament;</hi> oratio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:2:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 2, 9</bibl>; cf.: illud lascivum <foreign lang="greek">zwh\ kai\ yuxh/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 194</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n25933.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lascīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wantonly, lasciviously</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>licentiously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus facere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 278, 31</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lascivius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 514</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25933.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lascīvĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">wantonly, petulantly</hi>: ludere, Laev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 183</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
laser: <entryFree id="n25934" type="main" key="la_ser"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāser</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lāsar</orth>), <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the juice of the plant</hi> laserpitium, <hi rend="ital">assafœtida</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25934.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">laser e silphio profluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 23, 49, § 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus sucum vocant laser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laser Cyrenaicum vino diluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 23</bibl></cit>.—Jestingly of Maecenas: laser Arretinum, Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4, 12</bibl>. —Form lasar: <cit><quote lang="la">lasaris radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n25934.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> laserpitium <hi rend="ital">itself</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laseris radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 43, § 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 192" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 192</bibl>: 196. <cb n="LASS" /></sense></entryFree>
laseratum: <entryFree id="n25935" type="main" key="la_se^ra_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāsĕrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n25935.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
laseratus: <entryFree id="n25936" type="main" key="la_se^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāsĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laser</etym>, <sense id="n25936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flavored with</hi> laser. </sense><sense id="n25936.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25936.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lāsĕrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a condiment made from</hi> laser, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:1:30" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 1, 30</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
laserpiciarius: <entryFree id="n25937" type="hapax" key="la_serpi_ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāserpīcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laserpicium</etym>, <sense id="n25937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> laserpicium: <cit><quote lang="la">de laserpiciario mimo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35</bibl></cit> dub. (in Bip.: de laserpitio et minio).</sense></entryFree>
laserpiciatus: <entryFree id="n25938" type="main" key="la_serpi_ci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāserpīcĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prepared</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flavored with</hi> laserpicium: <cit><quote lang="la">acetum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 308</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laserpicifer: <entryFree id="n25939" type="main" key="la_serpi_ci^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāserpīcĭfer</orth>, v. lasarpicifer.</entryFree>
laserpicium: <entryFree id="n25940" type="main" key="la_serpi_ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāserpīcĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lāsarpīcĭum</orth>), <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> silphium, <hi rend="ital">from which the</hi> laser <hi rend="ital">was obtained</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 38</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">the juice of the</hi> silphium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lases: <entryFree id="n25941" type="gloss" key="La^ses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lăses</orth>, v. 1. Lares <sense id="n25941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
lasia: <entryFree id="n25942" type="main" key="Lasi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lasĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name of the island of Lesbos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 39, § 139</bibl>; also of <hi rend="ital">a small island near Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 31, 35, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lassesco: <entryFree id="n25943" type="main" key="lassesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lassesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n25943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [lassus], <hi rend="ital">to become tired, to grow weary</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne lassescat fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 40, 41, § 130</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 2, 4, § 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victo lassescere visu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> in Symm. 2, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassescere sub lorica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non bibet aquam et lassescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 44, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
