lassitudo: <entryFree id="n25944" type="main" key="lassi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lassĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faintness, weariness, heaviness, lassitude</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitationis finis esse debet lassitudo, quae citra fatigationem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia membra lassitudo mihi tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudinem hercle verba tua mihi addunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudinem alicui eximere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic (in lapicidinis) ibi demumst locus, ubi labore lassitudost exigunda ex corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artius ex lassitudine dormire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla lassitudo impedire officium et fidem debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros vires lassitudine deficiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudine confici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 92</bibl></cit> and 95: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu ac lassitudine exanimati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudine oppressi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timere, ne non virtute hostium, sed lassitudine sua vincerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in lassitudine homines proniores sunt ad iracundiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 24, 51, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citra lassitudinem exercere aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>not to weary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25944.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen. subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudo armorum equitandive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 26, § 52</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a term of reproach: lassitudo conservūm, reduviae flagri, <hi rend="ital">that wearies his fellowslaves with stripes</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=270" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 270</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lasso: <entryFree id="n25945" type="main" key="lasso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lasso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lassus</etym>, <sense id="n25945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to render faint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">languid, to tire, weary, fatigue, to deprive of vigor</hi> (syn.: fatigo, languefacio; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. not ante-Aug.): aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longior infirmum ne lasset epistola corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachia plagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 67; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lassata gravi ceciderunt brachia massā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:421" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visu lassatur inani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:707" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:483" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 483</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam vitia primo fervore adulescentiae indomita lassavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 68, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:70:3" default="NO">70, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:88:10" default="NO">88, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:19:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:149" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 16, 53, § 149</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina,</quote> <trans><tr>to weary with petitions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 695</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cecropiam Cotytto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 92</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus Hyperborei Bootae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bear steadfastly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassatum fluctibus aequor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>become calm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus lassatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassata triumphis fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 727</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:129" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lassulus: <entryFree id="n25946" type="hapax" key="lassu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lassŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n25946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">somewhat wearied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassulae nimio e labore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lassus: <entryFree id="n25947" type="main" key="lassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; acc. to Bopp, Gloss. 112, 6, for glassus from glasnus; kindred to Sanscr. glasnu, fessus, defessus, lassus; but more prob. collat. form of laxus; cf. langueo</etym>, <sense id="n25947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faint, languid, weary, tired, exhausted</hi> (syn.: fessus, fatigatus, defatigatus; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n25947.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassus de via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opere faciundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassus jam sum durando miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romani itinere atque opere castrorum et proelio fessi lassique erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recto itinere lassi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: assiduo gaudio, <cb n="LATE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab equo indomito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lasso mihi subvenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alieno aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:246" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marris ac vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 167</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">a lasso rixam quaeri (because tired persons are easily vexed),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:9:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 9, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25947.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassus maris et viarum Militiaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me amor lassum animi ludificat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25947.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassus pondus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1599" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1599</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n25947.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fueris nomen lassa vocare meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:28" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 28</bibl></cit> (3, 5, 12); 2, 15 (3, 7), 46; 2, 33 (3, 31), 26.—</sense><sense id="n25947.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">fructious assiduis lassa humus,</quote> <trans><tr>exhausted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:14" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lassa et effeta natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurae spatio ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba onerantia lassas aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <trans><tr>drooping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 436</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lasso collo jumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:146" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>become calm again</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 618</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <trans><tr>gently sloping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:330" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si res lassa labat, Itidem amici collabascunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp., sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> seem not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
lastaurus: <entryFree id="n25948" type="greek" key="lastaurus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lastaurus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/stauros</foreign>, <sense id="n25948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lewd person, debauchee</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latace: <entryFree id="n25949" type="greek" key="lata^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">latăcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n25949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magic herb</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 4, 9, § 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
late: <entryFree id="n25950" type="main" key="la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. latus <sense id="n25950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
latebra: <entryFree id="n25951" type="main" key="la^te_^bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătē^bra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lateo</etym>, <sense id="n25951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hiding-place, lurking-hole, covert, retreat</hi> (class.; most freq. in <number>plur.</number>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, II. B.). </sense><sense id="n25951.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aurum) in latebris situm est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque in totis aedibus tenebrae, latebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebris ac silvis aut saltibus se eripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cappadociae latebris se occultare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in latebras impellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at Scyllam caecis cohibet spelunca latebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum latebras animae, pectus mucrone recludit,</quote> <trans><tr>the hidden seat of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis defectus lunaeque latebrae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>eclipses of the moon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 751</bibl></cit>. —In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extractus e latebra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a place of refuge from war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 743</bibl></cit>: teli, <hi rend="ital">the weapon's lurking-place</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the place where the arrow-head was sticking in his body</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 389</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25951.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25951.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a lurking-place, hidden recess, retreat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in latebras abscondas (stultitiam) pectore penitissumo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 408</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum illa conjuratio ex latebris atque ex tenebris erupisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebras suspicionum peragrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 22, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 3</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibuit etiam latebram obscuritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:45:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 45, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabellae latebra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribendi,</quote> <trans><tr>a secret mode of writing, a writing in cipher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25951.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a subterfuge, shift, cloak, pretence, feigned excuse</hi> (only in <number>sing.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">latebram haberes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:33:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 33, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificam in latebram conjecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:20:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videant, ne quaeratur latebra perjurio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebram dare vitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:754" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 754</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latebricola: <entryFree id="n25952" type="hapax" key="la^te_^bri^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătē^brĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>com.</gen> <etym>latebra</etym>, <sense id="n25952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who dwells in lurking-places</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brothels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latebrose: <entryFree id="n25953" type="main" key="la^te_^bro_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătē^brōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. latebrosus <sense id="n25953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
latebrosus: <entryFree id="n25954" type="main" key="la^te_^bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătē^brōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>latebra</etym>, <sense id="n25954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of lurking-holes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coverts, hidden, retired, secret</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25954.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <trans><tr>lurking-places, disreputable haunts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: via, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:59:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 59, 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:713" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebrosae tempora noctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 153" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebrosa et lucifuga natio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>full of holes, porous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 587</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25954.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">intricate, obscure</hi> (late Lat.): latebrosissima quaestio. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Retract. 1:19" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Retract. 1, 19</bibl>.— Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătē^brōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a lurkingplace, secretly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se occultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latens: <entryFree id="n25955" type="main" key="la^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from lateo.</entryFree>
latenter: <entryFree id="n25956" type="main" key="la^tenter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. lateo, <sense id="n25956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin</hi>.</sense></entryFree>
lateo: <entryFree id="n25957" type="main" key="la^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root rah-, forsake; rahas, loneliness, concealment; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*l*a*q lanqa/nw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n25957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to lurk, be</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lie hid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concealed, to skulk</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n25957.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25957.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sunt, ubi latent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cochleae in occulto latent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 21</bibl>: occulte, id. <pb n="1039" /> <cb n="LATE" /> Agr. 2, 16, 41: <cit><quote lang="la">clam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 437</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abdite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:73:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 73, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:2:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub nomine pacis bellum latet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus latet inter tot flagitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non latuit scintilla ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">40, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves latent portu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:19" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuta arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 805</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">latet anguis in herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25957.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n25957.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be hidden, to be in safety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub umbra amicitiae Romae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub illius umbra Philotas latebam,</quote> <trans><tr>lurked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:10:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 10, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25957.5" n="2" level="3"> Jurid., <hi rend="ital">to lie hid, keep out of sight</hi>, in order not to appear before court, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 23, 74</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25957.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25957.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to live in concealment, to live retired</hi> (rare): crede mihi, bene qui latuit, bene vixit, <hi rend="ital">to lead a retired</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quiet life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:25" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25957.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., analog. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">lanqa/nein</foreign>, res latet, <hi rend="ital">to be concealed from, be unknown to</hi> one. </sense><sense id="n25957.9" n="(a)" level="5"> with <case>acc.</case> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fugit me, praeterit me, etc.): latet plerosque, siderum ignes esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 20, 18, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec latuere doli fratrem Junonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil illum latet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:126" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res Eumenem non latuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:8:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:2:2" default="NO">31, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen duplex, unum, quod latet nostrum sensum, alterum, quod apertum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25957.10" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae et oculis et auribus latere soleant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=92" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 92</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nobis haec auctoritas tamdiu tanta latuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostique propinquo Roma latet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:614" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 614</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25957.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Absol., to be concealed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obscure, to be unknown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum causarum aliae sunt perspicuae, aliae latent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum laterent hae partes (sc. Galliae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tantum accenderit ignem, Causa latet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id qua ratione consecutus sit, latet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., lying hid, hidden, concealed, secret, unknown</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa latentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">junctura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 15, 29, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem latentem explicare definiendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:41:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 41, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus in aegro corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:18" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas tentare latentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinius mandata latentia nati accipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:705" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 705</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latentior origo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Gen. ad Litt. 12:18" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Gen. ad Litt. 12, 18</bibl></cit>: caussa, id. Civ. Dei, 5, 19.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in latenti,</quote> <trans><tr>in secret, secretly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in secret, secretly, privately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:6:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 6, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellegere ex aliqua re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
later: <entryFree id="n25958" type="main" key="la^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lăter</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. root prath-, widen; prathas, breadth; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">platu/s, pla/tos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n25958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brick, tile</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25958.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil mirum, vetus est maceria, lateres si veteres ruunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">in latere aut in caemento, ex quibus urbs effecta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 47, 98</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">paries crudo latere ac luto constructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contabulationem summam lateribus lutoque constraverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateres de terra ducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateres coquere,</quote> <trans><tr>to burn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepimentum e lateribus coctilibus,</quote> <trans><tr>burnt bricks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: laterem lavare, <hi rend="ital">to wash a brick</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">pli/nqon plu/nein</foreign>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to wash the color out of a brick, to labor in vain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 8</bibl>; but cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:Sat. 9:19" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> Sat. 9, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25958.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: lateres aurei, argentei, <hi rend="ital">bars, ingots</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">wedges of gold, of silver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 17, § 56</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 131, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">520, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lateralis: <entryFree id="n25959" type="main" key="la^te^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. latus</etym>, <sense id="n25959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the side, lateral</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25959.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (ante- and post-class.): lateralis dolor, Enn. ap. Victor. p. 1963 P. (Ann. v. 601 Vahl.; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: lateris dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 21, 89, § 155</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">cingula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:6:40" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 6, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25959.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">saddle-bags</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:102" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lateramen: <entryFree id="n25960" type="hapax" key="la^te^ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>later</etym>, <sense id="n25960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any thing made like bricks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateramina vasi,</quote> <trans><tr>the earthen-ware</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 233</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lateranus: <entryFree id="n25961" type="main" key="La^te^ra_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĕrānus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n25961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a family name in the</hi> gens Claudia, Sextia, and Plautia.—So, Plautius Lateranus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:148" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 148</bibl>.—The splendid mansion of these Laterani on Mons Caelius (egregiae Lateranorum aedes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 17</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Lateranae aedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 587</bibl></cit>) was given by the emperor Constantine to the bishop of Rome; afterwards the seat of the popes; now <hi rend="ital">the Lateran</hi>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25962" type="main" key="La^te^ra_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĕrānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>later</etym>, <sense id="n25962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the god of the hearth</hi> (because hearths were made of bricks), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 130</bibl>. <cb n="LATI" /></sense></entryFree>
laterarius: <entryFree id="n25963" type="main" key="la^te^ra_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>later</etym>, <sense id="n25963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to bricks, brick-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25963.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra lateraria,</quote> <trans><tr>brick-clay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 45, § 156</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n25963.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n25963.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a brickmaker</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 445, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n25963.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕ-rārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. officina), <hi rend="ital">a brickkiln</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25964" type="main" key="la^te^ra_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. latus</etym>, <sense id="n25964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the sides;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. tigna), <hi rend="ital">side-beams</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laterculensis: <entryFree id="n25965" type="main" key="la^tercu^lensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătercŭlensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>laterculum</etym>, <sense id="n25965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who keeps the register of offices, a secretary</hi>, Cod. 12, 34, 5.</sense></entryFree>
laterculum: <entryFree id="n25966" type="main" key="la^tercu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătercŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>later</etym>, <sense id="n25966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a register of all the offices and dignities in the Roman empire</hi>, Cod. 1, 27, 1, § 7.—</sense><sense id="n25966.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a register, list</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laterculus: <entryFree id="n25967" type="main" key="la^tercu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătercŭlus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrĭcŭlus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 2</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n25967.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small brick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc contignationem laterculo astruxerunt, Caes. l. l.: sacellum factum crudis laterculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 7, 20, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">observationes siderum coctilibus laterculis inscriptae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 193</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25967.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n25967.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of pastry</hi>, so called because shaped like a tile, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 109</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil nisi laterculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25967.3" n="B" level="2"> Among the agrimensores, <hi rend="ital">a tile-shaped piece of land</hi>, Sic. Fl. de Cond. Agr. p. 2 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
laterensis: <entryFree id="n25968" type="main" key="la^te^rensis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. latus</etym>, <sense id="n25968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the side.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕren-sis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an attendant, body-guard, satellite</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25969" type="main" key="La^te^rensis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĕrensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Juventia; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. M. Juventius Laterensis,</quote> <trans><tr>a legate of Lepidus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl> saep.</sense></entryFree>
lateriana: <entryFree id="n25970" type="main" key="la^te^ri^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrĭāna</orth>, v. lateritana.</entryFree>
latericius: <entryFree id="n25971" type="main" key="la^te^ri_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>later</etym>, <sense id="n25971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consisting of bricks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <trans><tr>brickwork</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans><tr>built of bricks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paries,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 301</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrīcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">brickwork</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne saxa ex catapultis latericium discuterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laterina: <entryFree id="n25972" type="main" key="la^te^ri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brickkiln</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lateritana: <entryFree id="n25973" type="main" key="la^te^ri^ta_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrĭtāna</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrĭtĭāna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (pira), <sense id="n25973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a good sort of pears</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:4" default="NO">12, 10, 4</bibl>; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrĭāna</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 54</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrīsĭāna</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15</bibl>. (Perhaps pears from Laterium, in Arpinum; v. Laterium).</sense></entryFree>
lateritius: <entryFree id="n25974" type="main" key="la^te^ri_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĕrītĭus</orth>, v. latericius.</entryFree>
laterium: <entryFree id="n25975" type="main" key="La^te^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n25975.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a villa of Q. Cicero in Arpinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
laterna: <entryFree id="n25976" type="main" key="la_terna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lāterna</orth>, v. lanterna.</entryFree>
latesco: <entryFree id="n25977" type="hapax" key="la^tesco1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n25977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [lateo], <hi rend="ital">to hide one's self, lie hid, be concealed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Equus a capite et longa cervice latescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=385" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 385</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n25978" type="main" key="la_tesco2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n25978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [2. latus], <hi rend="ital">to grow broad, to widen</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">napi non in ventrem latescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa paulatim latescentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis sex latescit fascia partes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 680</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latet: <entryFree id="n25979" type="main" key="la^tet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătet</orth>, v. lateo, II. B.</entryFree>
latex: <entryFree id="n25980" type="main" key="la^tex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 658</bibl> P.), <sense id="n25980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a liquid, fluid</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>).—So esp. of water: <cit><quote lang="la">latices simulatos fontis Averni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:512" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 512</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lethaei ad fluminis undam Securos latices et longa oblivia potant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desilit in latices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes laticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occulti latices,</quote> <trans><tr>hidden springs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latex aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laticum frugumque cupido,</quote> <trans><tr>thirst and hunger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1093" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1093</bibl></cit>.—Of wine: <cit><quote lang="la">liquoris vitigeni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—Of other liquids: <cit><quote lang="la">absinthi,</quote> <trans><tr>juice of wormwood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palladii,</quote> <trans><tr>oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nivei,</quote> <trans><tr>milk</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lathyris: <entryFree id="n25981" type="greek" key="lathy^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lathyris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (collat. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lā-thyr</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 1099</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">laquri/s</foreign>, <sense id="n25981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, a kind of wolf's-milk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 71, § 95</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lathyros: <entryFree id="n25982" type="greek" key="lathy^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lathyros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">la/quros</foreign>, <sense id="n25982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> leontopodion, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latialis: <entryFree id="n25983" type="main" key="La^ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭālis</orth>, e; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭālĭter</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭar</orth>, āris; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭāris</orth>, e; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭārĭter</orth>, v. Latium, II. D. <cb n="LATI" /></entryFree>
latibulor: <entryFree id="n25984" type="main" key="la^ti^bu^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĭbŭlor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n25984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [latibulum], <hi rend="ital">to be concealed, to lie hid, to lurk</hi> (ante-class.): nocte ut opertus amictu latibuletur, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 133, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 10" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 10</bibl> (acc. to Perott. Cornucop. also used by Varro in the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form: vide, ne servus domino latibulet).</sense></entryFree>
latibulum: <entryFree id="n25985" type="main" key="la^ti^bu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĭbŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lateo</etym>, <sense id="n25985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hiding-place, lurking-hole, covert, den</hi>, of animals. </sense><sense id="n25985.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum etiam ferae latibulis se tegant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens e latibulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furibunda ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 54</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of men: latibulis occultorum locorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 215, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25985.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hidingplace, refuge</hi>, etc. (syn. receptaculum): <cit><quote lang="la">latibulum et perfugium doloris mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere occepit ex diffidentia latibulum aliquod temeritati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 1, p. 274, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laticlavialis: <entryFree id="n25986" type="gloss" key="la_ti^cla_vi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭclāvĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>laticlavius</etym>, for laticlavius: <sense id="n25986.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">‡TRIBVNVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 180, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laticlavium: <entryFree id="n25987" type="main" key="la_ti^cla_vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭclāvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. laticlavius, II. B.</entryFree>
laticlavius: <entryFree id="n25988" type="main" key="la_ti^cla_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭclāvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. latus-clavus, II. 4.</etym>, <sense id="n25988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a broad purple stripe, broad-striped</hi>. </sense><sense id="n25988.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mappa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32</bibl></cit>: tunica (a mark of distinction borne by senators, military tribunes of the equestrian order, and the sons of distinguished families who were fitting themselves for offices of state; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">clavus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>, n. 7: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 133</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25988.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n25988.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭclāvĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one entitled to wear the</hi> latus clavus, <hi rend="ital">a senator, patrician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quodam laticlavio prope ad necem caesus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 38</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n25988.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭclāvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, for laticlavus, <hi rend="ital">a broad purple stripe on the tunic</hi>, worn as a mark of distinction (v. supra): laticlavium <foreign lang="greek">platu/shmon</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:1:42" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 1, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per laticlavii honorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
laticlavus: <entryFree id="n25989" type="main" key="la_ti^cla_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭclāvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n25989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broad stripe on the toga</hi> of senators (v. clavus and laticlavius; late Lat.), Cod. Th. 6, 4, 17.</sense></entryFree>
latifico: <entryFree id="n25990" type="gloss" key="la_ti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭfĭco</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">platu/nw</foreign>, <sense id="n25990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make wide, to widen</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
latifolius: <entryFree id="n25991" type="main" key="la_ti^fo^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭfŏlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. latus-folium</etym>, <sense id="n25991.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">broad-leaved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latifundium: <entryFree id="n25992" type="main" key="la_ti^fundi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭfundĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>1. latus-fundus</etym>, <sense id="n25992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large landed property, large estate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">farm</hi> (not ante-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi latifundiis vestris maria cinxistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 89:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 89, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metiri me geometres docet latifundia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 88:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 88, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">possidere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latiloquens: <entryFree id="n25993" type="gloss" key="la_ti^lo^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭlŏquens</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">platulo/gos</foreign> (qui magna loquitur), Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
latinae: <entryFree id="n25994" type="main" key="La^ti_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (sc. feriae); <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Latium, II. B.</entryFree>
latiniensis: <entryFree id="n25995" type="main" key="La^ti_ni^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnĭensis</orth>, e. <sense id="n25995.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Latin</hi>, v. Latium, II. C.—</sense><sense id="n25995.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Caelius Latiniensis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 19, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latinigena: <entryFree id="n25996" type="main" key="La^ti_ni^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Latium-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n25996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one born in Latium</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1285</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
latinitas: <entryFree id="n25997" type="main" key="la^ti_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătīnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Latinus</etym>. <sense id="n25997.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pure Latin style, Latinity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latinitas est, quae sermonem purum conservat, ab omni vitio remotum. Vitia in sermone, quominus is latinus sit, duo possunt esse: soloecismus et barbarismus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secutus sum non dico Caecilium (malus enim auctor latinitatis est), sed Terentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n25997.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Latin law</hi>, also called jus Latii (v. Latium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium quasdam foederatas, latinitate vel civitate donavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latinius: <entryFree id="n25998" type="main" key="La^ti_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n25998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinius Latiaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinius Pandus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latinizo: <entryFree id="n25999" type="main" key="la^ti_ni_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătīnīzo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. Latinus</etym>, <sense id="n25999.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to translate into Latin</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:1:8" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latino: <entryFree id="n26000" type="hapax" key="la^ti_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătīno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to express in Latin, translate into Latin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:4:77" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 4, 77</bibl> (dub.; al. latinizavimus).</sense></entryFree>
latinus: <entryFree id="n26001" type="main" key="La^ti_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Latium, II. B.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n26002" type="main" key="La^ti_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n26002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Laurentians, who favorably received Æneas and gave him his daughter Lavinia in marriage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:45 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 45 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs Latini, i. e. Laurentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 891</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latio: <entryFree id="n26003" type="main" key="la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fero</etym>, <sense id="n26003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bearing, bringing</hi> (only in the trop. signif.). * </sense><sense id="n26003.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilii,</quote> <trans><tr>a rendering of assistance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>. 1.—</sense><sense id="n26003.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (cf. fero). </sense><sense id="n26003.3" n="A" level="2"> Suffragii latio, <hi rend="ital">a voting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">right of voting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43</bibl>, <pb n="1040" /> <cb n="LATI" /> 24; 38, 36, 7; <cit><quote lang="la">45, 15, 3: legis latio,</quote> <trans><tr>a proposing of a law, a bill</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 26</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n26003.4" n="B" level="2"> Expensi latio, <hi rend="ital">a setting down of expenditures, entering of money paid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latipes: <entryFree id="n26004" type="hapax" key="la_ti^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭpēs</orth>, <itype>ĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. latus-pes</etym>, <sense id="n26004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">broadfooted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Prog. Arat. 358</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
latitabundus: <entryFree id="n26005" type="hapax" key="la^ti^ta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĭtābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>latito</etym>, <sense id="n26005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying hid, skulking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
latitatio: <entryFree id="n26006" type="main" key="la^ti^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hiding, lurking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:4:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
latitator: <entryFree id="n26007" type="main" key="la^ti^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n26007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lies hid</hi>, Aug.</sense></entryFree>
latitia: <entryFree id="n26008" type="main" key="la_ti^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. latus</etym>, <sense id="n26008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">breadth, width</hi> (late Lat.): fines in latitia breviores, Auct. Rei Agrar. p. 222 Goes.; opp. longitia, Inscr. ap. Marin. Iscriz. Alb. p. 119.</sense></entryFree>
latito: <entryFree id="n26009" type="main" key="la^ti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lătĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n26009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [lateo], <hi rend="ital">to be hid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concealed, to lie hid, hide, lurk</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n26009.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille ignavissimus Mihi latitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitans Oppianicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitans aper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. subjects, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:875 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 875 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram latitare minute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 890</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:642" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 642</bibl>: invisis atque latitantibus rebus confidere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26009.2" n="B" level="2"> Latitare aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to hide</hi> from any one (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:1:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 1, 8</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n26009.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., jurid., <hi rend="ital">to lie hid, keep out of the way</hi>, in order not to appear before court: qui fraudationis causa latitarit, Edict. Praet. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 19, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:78" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si latitare ac diutius ludificare videatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 17, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:31:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 31, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:4:7:section=3 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 4, 7, § 3 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
latitudo: <entryFree id="n26010" type="main" key="la_ti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lātĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. latus</etym>, <sense id="n26010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">breadth, width</hi> of any thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n26010.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac immensitate latitudinum, longitudinum, altitudinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:20:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 20, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra amplius milibus passuum VIII. in latitudinem patebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patere in latitudinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3</bibl> prooem. § 3; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:141" default="NO">11, 3, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires umerorum et latitudines ad aratra extrahenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n26010.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">extent, size, compass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">possessionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26010.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>a broad pronunciation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 91</bibl></cit>: Platonica, <hi rend="ital">richness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">copiousness of expression</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 5</bibl> (for the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">platu/ths th=s e(rmh nei/as</foreign>, called amplitudo Platonis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 5</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
latium: <entryFree id="n26011" type="main" key="La^ti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. lătus; Sanscr. root prath-, to spread or widen; cf. Lat. later, etc.; prop., the plains or flat-land; <cit><quote lang="la">by the ancients referred to latēre, because here Saturnus lay concealed from his son,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:238" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 238</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 322</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 13</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or to Latinus,</quote> <trans><tr>the name of the mythical king</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 32</bibl></cit> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n26011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country of Italy, in which Rome was situated</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Campagna di Roma</hi>, and a part of the <hi rend="ital">Terra di Lavoro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 54</bibl>; Enn. ap. Acro. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 37</bibl> (Ann. v. 455); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:24:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 24, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 35, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">consisting of two parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latium vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">or antiquum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 56</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">which was the original territory governed by Rome before the subjugation of the Æqui and Volsci, and</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latium novum, or adjectum,</quote> <trans><tr>originally the territory of the Æqui, Volsci, Hernici, and Aurunci</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 59</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n26011.1" n="B" level="2"> Jus Latii, <hi rend="ital">the political rights and privileges which belonged originally to the Latins, but were afterwards granted by the Romans to other people; this</hi> jus <hi rend="ital">comprehended less than</hi> civitas Romana, <hi rend="ital">but more than</hi> peregrinitas (cf. latinitas and Latini): <cit><quote lang="la">eodem anno Caesar nationes Alpium maritimarum in jus Latii transtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 32</bibl></cit>. —Also called Latium alone: aut majus est Latium aut minus; majus est Latium, cum et hi, qui decuriones leguntur, et ei qui honorem aliquem aut magistratum gerunt, civitatem Romanam consecuntur; <cit><quote lang="la">minus Latium est, cum hi tantum, qui vel magistratum vel honorem gerunt, ad civitatem Romanam perveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:96" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Latium externis dilargiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latio dato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 2, 1, § 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latio donata oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26011.2" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n26011.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭ-us</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Latium, Latian, Latin</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <trans><tr>the Latin territory</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:553" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 553</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 606</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 832</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:3:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: palmes, <hi rend="ital">vines growing</hi> <cb n="LATI" /> <hi rend="ital">in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:894" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 894</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">Roman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans><tr>the Roman people</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:639" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 639</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:243" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 243</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:133" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Roman year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>of Roman soldiers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 414</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26011.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Latium, Latin</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26011.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: populi, <hi rend="ital">the Latins</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 28</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 24 Vahl.); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Latins, Romans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <trans><tr>the Latin language</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 1</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. Graeca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae, opp. Graeci,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: via, <hi rend="ital">beginning at the</hi> Porta Latina, <hi rend="ital">near the</hi> Porta Capena, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:59:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 59, 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 36 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans><tr>the days of the Roman calendar, the Roman year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:177" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 177</bibl></cit>: feriae, <hi rend="ital">the festival of the allied Latins, which was celebrated especially by offerings to</hi> Juppiter Latiaris <hi rend="ital">on</hi> Mons Albanus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=25" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 25</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
