D. 1, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 1</bibl>; more freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr> 2.: coloniae, <hi rend="ital">which possessed the</hi> jus Latii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 8</bibl>: nomen, <hi rend="ital">Latin citizenship</hi>, also called jus Latii and Latinitas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39, 2</bibl> (v. socius): casus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the ablative</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 277</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">tragici veteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse illud Latinum (verbum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: nihil Latinius legi, M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. 2:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. 2, 6</bibl> Mai.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil Latinius tuis voluminibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 58, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo Latinissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 50, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in Latin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graece haec vocatur emporos: eadem Latine mercator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cumanis petentibus, ut publice Latine loquerentur, et praeconibus Latine vendendi jus esset,</quote> <trans><tr>in the Latin tongue</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire,</quote> <trans><tr>to understand Latin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 19, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">num Latine scit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim tam praeclarum est scire Latine, quam turpe nescire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nescire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:188" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 188</bibl></cit>: reddere, <hi rend="ital">to translate into Latin</hi>, Cic. de Or, 1, 34, 153; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—In partic.: Latine loqui, <hi rend="ital">to speak with propriety</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elegance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latine et diligenter loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:45:166" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 45, 166</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pure et emendate loquentes, quod est Latine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pure et Latine loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:32:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 32, 144</bibl></cit>.—Sometimes, also, like our <hi rend="ital">to talk plain English</hi>, for, <hi rend="ital">to speak out, to speak plainly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">openly</hi> (syn. Romano more loqui): <cit><quote lang="la">(gladiator), ut appellant ii, qui plane et Latine loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latine me scitote, non accusatorie loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:148" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formare,</quote> <trans><tr>to compose in Latin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl></cit>: componere, id. Gram. <hi rend="ital">init.—Comp.</hi>: Latinius, <hi rend="ital">in better Latin</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 8, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26011.6" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n26011.7" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n26011.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The inhabitants of Latium, Latins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 32</bibl> sq.; 2, 19 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 31, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 367</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:44" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 44</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n26011.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Those who possessed the Latin rights of citizenship</hi> (jus Latii, Latinitas); <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in the connection, socii et Latini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl> (v. socius).— </sense><sense id="n26011.10" n="(g)" level="5"> Latini Juniani, <hi rend="ital">freedmen whose liberty was secured by the operation of the</hi> lex Junia Norbana (772 A. U. C.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=56" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n26011.11" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. feriae), <hi rend="ital">the festival of the allied Latins, the Latin holidays</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:19" default="NO" valid="yes">19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; id. poët. Div. 1, 11, 18.—</sense><sense id="n26011.12" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Latin, the Latin language</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet in Latinum illa convertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:14:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 14, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Latinum vertore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n26011.13" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătī-nĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Latin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 69</bibl></cit>: ager, Auct. Harusp. Resp. 10, 20.— In <hi rend="ital">plur absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătīnĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Latins</hi>, Auct. Harusp. Resp. 28, 62.—</sense><sense id="n26011.14" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭālis</orth>, and euphon. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lă-tĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭar</orth>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Latium, Latin</hi>. </sense><sense id="n26011.15" n="1" level="3"> Form Latialis: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Latins, Romans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 198</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, also, caput,</quote> <trans><tr>a statue of Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 535</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., in the Latin manner</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">peplo circa umeros involuto Latialiter tegebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil effari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, § 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te Latialiter sonantem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 235</bibl></cit> (al. Latiariter).—</sense><sense id="n26011.16" n="2" level="3"> Form Latiaris: Latiaris sancte Juppiter (Juppiter Latiaris was the guardian deity of the Latin confederacy, to whom the feriae Latinae were consecrated),<cb n="LATR" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 43</bibl></cit> Sillig. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 52</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina Latiaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭārĭter</orth>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the preced.</ref></xr> 1.—</sense><sense id="n26011.17" n="b" level="4"> Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lătĭar</orth>, <itype>āris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the festival of Jupiter Latiaris</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">confectum erat Latiar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
